    2014-04-24: This is not my first time purchasing Ringke cases and I'm sure it won't be the last. This is by far, my favorite brand for smartphone cases, without any doubt.Both my wife and I own Nexus 4 with Ringke cases and we just loved them. A few weeks ago we purchased a Moto G for our nephew and, of course, we included a properly Ringke case for it. Compared to our Nexus 4 cases, the Moto G case is way much better and almost perfect:Materials feel much better than the Nexus 4 case and it has a much softer surface and rounded corners that are really awesome to touch and hold. Also, somehow this material left less fingerprints than our Nexus 4 cases. So far, this case has 5 stars.As with any Ringke case, they are very hard (my Nexus 4 has survived 2 drops to the floor from the table, without a single scratch) and also very thin and elegant (they really don't add any bulk to the phone).My 4 star review it's because a very small detail: the front corners need to be a little "taller" or "thicker", so when placing the phone face down the screen is more separated from the table (as it is with the Nexus 4 case). That said: adding +1 or 2 mm to the corners will help the Moto G screen last longer without a scratch, but this is just an issue for people like me, who uses Gravity Screen On/Off and puts the phone face down against the table in order to sleep the screen (most people keep the phone face up). Nevertheless, the corners do separate the screen from the surface when placing the pone face down, but I just thing it's not enough. That small change and I'll definitely rate it 5 star.The plus feature about this case is that includes a free screen protector, but as the Moto G comes with Gorilla Glass 3 (which is virtually unscratchable for a common everyday use, same as our Nexus 4), we haven't installed it yet and probably we won't do it anyway... but for those who feel they need the extra protection it's a great deal and you'll save a few bucks.

    2012-09-14: I've been a Wilson fan since their days of manufacturing HF yagis and love my Wilson Sleek. I decided to upgrade to this gain antenna for increasing signal strength. However, this antenna shows zero improvement over the little zero DB gain spike that comes with the Sleek. My guess is the RG174 is higher loss than the thicker cable that comes with the spike antenna and counteracts any gain from this antenna.

    Rating: 1

    2013-11-05: So the little dinky antenna on my Verizon Wireless Network Extender broke internally. It looked fine physically, but my phones were no longer sync'ing with the Extender box. I took apart the factory stubby antenna and ohm'd it out. Open circuit, with the break somewhere in the plastic elbow of the antenna.For the price, I figured messing with the factory stubby antenna wasn't worth my time and bought this Wilson antenna instead. It fits perfectly and works MUCH better than the factory antenna ever did.Just remember that this is a "mobile" antenna, so it needs to be on something metallic to act as a ground plane. For my "installation", I have the antenna stuck to the top of a metal file cabinet, which is working fine as a ground plane.

    Rating: 5

    2013-09-25: Small but mounts on top of vehicle and connects to the Wilson cell phone booster to bring in more signal.

    Rating: 5

    2013-11-19: This antenna added even more signal to my Wilson Sleek cradle. I traded out all my vehicles for this antenna. I would highly recommend this to anyone!!

    Rating: 5

    2014-07-03: Huge improvement over the stock Wilson antenna. On Verizon, my LG G2 signal went from -92 to -82dBm on 1x, and from -102 to -85dBm on LTE.

    Rating: 5

In Yellowstone, where I spend a lot of time, it is now a matter of the few areas I don't have coverage, whereas before, it was a matter of figuring out what few areas I had some coverage, at least enough to make a phone call.     2013-10-28: I purchased this antenna to boost my Verizon 3G Broadband device while inside my RV. I had originally placed my 3G Broadband device inside the Wilson Sleek (designed for cell phones), using the original mini-antenna. However, that antenna was a little too weak to pick up signals in the deserts of California. So, I purchased this antenna and replaced the other one. I use this antenna inside my RV near a window. I have this antenna magnetically stuck to a Coleman metal camping plate/dish (used as a plane). Its working just fine, and picking up 2 more bars! Now, I can use my ROKU box without all the buffering. So, this antenna actually worked for me, and I was very skeptical at first. Also, the metal camping dish/plate works well as an inductor. I tried a metal cup and other metal objects but the metal plate works wonders!

This thing cost a few bucks, if it gets ruined, buy another one. Big deal.All the other reviews about "Well, it's not real leather!" and "It won't close properly..."     2013-02-23: I also have the other style of Nexus 7 (by Supcase), which more completely covers the tablet. Both styles are great, and each has different advantages. I prefer this Nanum case because it exposes the tablet nicely when the case is opened, and I can easily remove it completely if I want. It is an exceptional value for the price, and the blue one I received is a very nice color (more subdued than what is shown in the photos).

    Rating: 5

    2013-06-21: First off, the stylus that comes with the case is a lot of fun to use, but it has kind of a low construction quality, so don't expect it to last too long. Secondly, and more importantly, the case was of good quality. It did, however, take a little while to figure out how to actually use it as a stand. It came pretty stiff, and I didn't realize I was supposed to bend the back of it back to get it to be used as a stand. That was my fault though. After a little while, the clips that hold the tablet at the bottom (when it's in landscape) loosen up a lot, and make it a lot easier to use. It's hard to manage at first though, and takes a few weeks to break it in. There's a really hard clip that holds the case close around the tablet, and I don't really like it. At the same time, I don't know of another way to effectively hold it closed, so I can't really say much. If you use this case for a while, you'll eventually notice the paint on the bezel of the tablet starting to wear off, so keep an eye out for that.I do really like that it will act as a stand for two different angles, and very relevant angles at that. I do like it, overall, and it served me well while taking the tablet to and from class to take notes on.

    Rating: 4

    2013-01-06: First thing to make clear, in the picture shown the case looked a like brighter blue than it actually is... It's really almost navy. That ignored, the case could best be described as a "you get what you pay for" sort of item.Until I received this case, I'd been using a Kindle Fire case with the exact same design (Vuscape by Targus) on my Nexus 7. That case was more padded and the case material was a bit softer. The upside to not having that padding is that this case is a tad bit slimmer... I don't know if that means there's less protection or if it matters at all. The inside material is pretty generic. The speaker has openings on the back and the microphones are clear. The case fits around the buttons well too.For it's low price, it does a great job protecting the screen and acting as a stand. While standing, you can use as much force as you wish to type, swipe, and press. Unlike the ipad style, folding smart cover design, where the upright standing mode is prone to falling over with anything more than light pressing. I would say this is one of the best designs for people that actually need to type on their devices in standing mode.The sleep/awake function in this case works perfectly, and the sensor does not get confused when the cover is open and pulled around, a common issue with other cases with the sleep/awake functionality.The case would probably be good for a 4/5 star rating but the "Blue" shown isn't accurate to what's being sent out.

    Rating: 3

    2013-07-27: I would definitely recommend this to anyone needing protection for their Nexus 7. Sharp looking, sturdy and the stand feature works great.

    Rating: 5

    2013-09-13: I ordered this for my new 2013 nexus 7. I expected the case to come with a smooth black finish. Instead, it came with an even better carbon fiber look to it. I love it.The corners are pretty strong and hold the tablet in place. Time will though. My dad has a similar case for his kindle fire HD and the bottom no longer holds well due to switching to the landscape multiview position so often. The bottom right corner in landscape mode is very tight on this case. When taking it off, it nearly separates the back cover from the glass. But no complaints here, its a tight fit and don't plan on removing it a lot. Couldn't figure out what the elastic band was for in front but it may be to hold the case together when in portrait mode. I wrap it over the tablets glass, then pull the middle down to the closing latch so only the corners are a little covered by the strap. Hope that makes sense.Great case overall!

    2012-05-17: I bought this to throw in the suitcase for a trip. I wanted something retractable and small...and this seemed to fit the bill. But it sometimes has a mind of its own...PRO:1, compact. Like the fact that the plug folds down and the cord retracts into the unit.CON:We have Android phones (Samsung and Motorola--both brands stated in the post), and when it is plugged in to charge, it does a couple of things. It started out fine, but after about the 6th use it got all weird on me:1, on the Samsung (Galaxy 2) it freezes the main screen, and cooks the battery as it charges. And I mean COOK. Like you have just taken a torch to it. I know that batteries heat when they charge, but wow, this seemed like it was damaging the phone;2, on the Motorola (Droid X), it turned on my g-Talk screen and sent the weirdest string of letters, symbols, and numbers as a message---all night long as it charged. 2 different friends woke up to these bizarre messages that were HUNDREDS if not THOUSANDS of characters long. And the phone wasn't even ON! I always turn the phone off (granted, not to 'power off' mode) when I plug the phone in to charge. It also cooks the battery.3, it doesn't charge everything with a micro USB--thought it would charge my Nook and Kindle, but it won't.Not sure about this one, to be honest. I think as it ages, it gets funky. It concerns me of the heat it generates in the phone batteries...maybe opting out of convenience and just getting another charger for the phones would be the best thing. The phones and/or batteries are far more expensive to replace than the cost of this 'convenience charger'. Maybe for a first use or a very short use it would be fine, but I'm guessing that it has a short shelf life.I won't be buying another.

    2014-04-06: I have been using this charger since November 2013 and it has a permanent home inside my backpack!     Rating: 4

    2014-01-10: UPDATE 3/2/14 (~3 months after purchase)tl;dr, I'm updating my review because this product is absolutely fantastic. I am very pleased with it's performance. If you're looking for a great external battery with tons of power, this is the one to get.I'm not exactly sure when I bought this product, but it has single-handedly changed the way I use my mobile devices. It's 12000 mAh capacity is perfect for those, like me, who are always connected on at least one device.I bought this product primarily because I always find myself with a low battery and no outlet in sight. I travel on public transportation and I don't know the systems so I use Google maps to get around. I also use my phone to tether when my school's wifi quits.Exterior:No buttons and a beautiful LED ring to let you know how much juice you have left. Each ring is approximately 10%, so you're not left to guess with 4 or 5 LEDs. The shake to wake feature is very sensitive but I keep the battery in my bag most of the time and I haven't noticed any loss of power from it. The soft touch material on the exterior is very elegant and I appreciate the design.Performance:I'm no battery tester but I can tell this product is efficient. It's charged my iPhone 5s 6 times from absolutely dead -with more juice left- on just one charge. It charges my phone rapidly, maybe two hours tops in the smart port. It also charged my phone, kindle, and beats at the same time. I am very pleased.Amenities:I only got the battery, a case (which is not at all cheap), and a short (6in is my best guess) micro-USB to USB cable for charging. You will need your own USB to wall charger, but if you have any devices to use the battery with you'll have something laying around. I didn't receive a longer cord or any iPhone wire when I purchased, contrary to other reviews.All in all, this is the perfect device for the tech-obsessed person or the unfortunate souls who can never seem to find an outlet. I recommend this product.Please note that I did not review this product for any gain, I did not receive any product for free or discount nor any financial incentive. These are my opinions and my opinions only.PREVIOUS REVIEW: The Anker Astro3 is a great great product and has helped me, as a student, remain efficient.The Astro3 is beautiful. It's smooth, doesn't have obnoxious branding, and feels great to hold. It is not that heavy, and fits great into my bag.The large battery (12000 mAh) charges all my devices (AT THE SAME TIME, TOO!) andI have a smaller Anker battery that looks like lipstick, and I gave that to my mom when I got this product. Don't get me wrong, that works great too, but I realized that I'd rather a larger battery.I have noticed that the "shake-to-activate" is very sensitive, but if it's set off and not connected to any devices it doesn't stay on and serves just as a charge percentage indicator.I love that Anker used 10 LED's because it makes it easy to recognize the charge. 3 lights? 30%! Easy and well designed. I also really like the case they gave me! My Astro rarely leaves its little pocket, and if you put it in with the ports up you won't ever have to take it out!I cannot attest to the actual mAh in the battery, but neither can most people. It charges my phone tons of times, and I've even had it in my bed plugged into my phone overnight. It charged my iPhone up to 100%, and since I bounced around all night it kept it there. However, I didn't notice any significant battery drain, and the Astro3 charged up my beats, kindle, and iPad before dying. I'm very satisfied and I would DEFINITELY recommend this product!Edit: Forgot to add that I use this product almost solely with the AmazonBasics 4 inch Lightning cable, and it works like a charm! It keeps my bag from becoming cluttered. I'm very very happy with it.

    Rating: 5

    2014-01-04: I bought this for my son-in-law who has an iPad and iPhone. He seems pleased with it. I bought it because he goes camping and travels for work. It seems the perfect unit for these activities.

    Rating: 5

    2014-05-01: I have been using it for about 3 months now. My only issue is that it takes nearly a day (24hr) to charge back up. However, once it's charged it lasts a while.

    Rating: 4

    2013-12-01: I have several portable battery chargers. The ones I find the most reliable are the Anker batteries. I like this model in particular because of the smart port which can give a higher amperage charge. The only downside I have found is the slow speed (over 9 hours for me) to recharge this battery pack. Based on negative experiences with other companies like New Trent, I only purchase batteries with longer warranties like the Anker. Anker has an 18 month warranty.

    Rating: 5

    2014-04-27: I just bought two of these batteries last week and had the chance to use them over the weekend. I'm very pleased. They do what they promised. Thanks to PowerIQ, they can charge any device on any port, rather than having to put Apple devices in some ports and Androids in others for best charging efficiency -- I've always felt I was getting only half the use out of those devices. My only wish for these batteries would be for the output to match the number of ports at full speed (2.4 * 3 = 7.2amps out shared among the three ports), as the total amps shared by the three ports is 5.I have an app on my android tablet that tells me what my amps are coming in when I plug the device into a charger. When I've used ports that were designated for Apple, even though the port was rated at 2.1 to 2.4 amps, it would read lower coming in than the Android port that was was listed as 1.0 to 1.2 amps. With these batteries, I get the same amps on every port.I'm also very pleased with the capacity, although I did consider going with a bigger battery. I stayed with these batteries because of their ability to be charged using USB. The larger batteries had to be charged with using direct power. My aim is to be able to use solar panels with USB output to charge the batteries when I travel. It's a lot more versatile to be able to charge the batteries, rather than the devices, using solar panels, with the main point being able to keep my sensitive devices out of the sun when charging. And Anker appears to have the best USB solar panel out there right now -- although it doesn't say it has the PowerIQ ports yet.

    Rating: 5

    2013-09-15: I use this for camping and it'll keep my nexus 7/kindle paperwhite/phone charged up and ready to go for weekend camping trips!

    Rating: 5

    2014-06-02: This is another nice and quality product. Since there are so many good reviews, I don't think I need to belabor the plus points, other than pointing out the fact its form factor makes it easier to carry it with my smartphone around, when my phone's battery is running low. I does feel a bit heavy because of the bigger battery capacity. But it would definitely beats the other two Anker models (9000mAh & 6000mAh). Being able to provide 2A on all ports are critical, too, because I usually need to charge the bluetooth headset.I took a few issues with the product, based on my experience after using it for weeks. My chief comparison is with the first-gen TYLT charger that I have carried for a long time.http://www.amazon.com/PowerPlant-Universal-Portable-Battery-MicroUSB/dp/B00J5MID3K/First, the main disappointment is that it cannot charge any device when itself is being charged. This is a big disappointment that affects how you use the product. Think about the fact that it takes more than a few hours to fully charge the device, my natural inclination is to charge this overnight. Yet, I could not throw away my other chargers since I could not keep charging my devices at the same time. What I end up doing is to charge my devices using TYLT overnight, when the Anker battery is re-juiced at the same time, so that I can wake up with everything fully charged.Second, the white LED is too bright. It shines brightly on the ceiling at night when it is charged facing up. Because it pulsating the brightness during charging, it could interfere with sleep for someone.Thirdly, it comes with one charging USB cable. I would hoped that it came with four, so that I don't have to fish around to use my older cables. It is well known that USB cables tend to wear out (especially those micro-USB connectors). When they do, charging performance deteriorates significantly. The supplied cable feels tight when plugged in, and it charges fast. So I have reason to assume that it is a high-quality cable. I would hoped that it came with a bunch. I would not mind if I paid a few bucks more for that convenience, since this price range of this product has already made it into the premium product category.In summary, I am carrying this as my go-to battery when I'm out and about. But I cannot depend on it for charging my devices overnight, because I need to make sure both my devices and this battery is fully charged the next morning.

    Rating: 4

    2014-05-23: Great cost, great construction, and powerful. Can fully charge my Galaxy Note 3 aprox. three times with just one charge, and as fast as the original wall charger wouldJust wish I could plug it directly to the AC outlet to charge it instead of using another USB wall charger....

    Rating: 5

    2013-09-30: A bit heavy, but will all that juice...what do what...great power source to have handy. Especially for those silly people with Apple phones...you are gonna need to extra power handy.

    Rating: 5

    2014-07-11: If you need a powerful charger (12000mAh) that will complete MULTIPLE charge cycles with multiple ports, look no further: The Anker 2nd Gen Astro3 is a great product. I have charged my iPhone 5s 4x, a Samsung S3 twice, an iPad2 and Galaxy Note II all without having to re-charge the Astro3 (going on 1 week now; I have purposely not re-charged it and have been using it for everything to see how long one charge would last). The unit is built like a brick; well constructed, visually pleasing, great non-slip outer finish/gloss-black sides and the power indicator/light is a great feature. Don't know how much power you have left? Give the Astro3 a "shake" and it displays the power available. Amazing.Comes with a carrying case, although the case (very similar to a sunglasses "bag") is a tight fit and does not have enough room for the charging cable. That is the only negative I have found and is not enough to lower my 5-star rating.I charged an iPhone 5s, iPad 2 and Samsung S3 (all with less than 20% battery life remaining) all at once and the Astro3 fully-charged all 3 and still had power in reserve (about 1/4 remaining).This is a great product and I highly recommend this unit...with 3 USB ports and so much power, I think I could go 5-7 days with a full charge if I was traveling and never run out of battery life on my iPhone 5s while using the phone regularly. Great product!!

    Rating: 5

    2013-10-05: This is my 3rd charger I've tried and they all are overly generous on how many times you can charge your phone or tablet. This one can't even charge my Nexus 7 twice. One charge from 10% to full and the battery pack was down to 3 bars which is enough to charge my Evo LTE from 50% to full once. They claim 6 to 7 charges for most phones, they aren't talking about today's smart phones with huge battery's. I'd be lucky to get 4 charges from empty on My Evo. 6 to 7 charges if I only let it get down to 50% maybe. It will get you through a weekend. The "smart" port... Charges my Nexus 7 (2012) super slowwww. The other ports charge fine. When plugged into the smart port it says 8 hours until charged from 70%!!! Plug into the other port and it changes to 1 hour and instantly starts going up. The shake to wake seems to do nothing also, like even if you don't shake it and just plug something in it starts charging. Shake to wake also causes it to turn on and off any time you move it in the slightest. Haven't noticed any power loss from this though.

    Rating: 2

    2014-07-19: After using this for a couple days I can honestly say this is the best money I've spent. The pack shows how much battery is left just by shaking it, which is the easiest I've ever seen. Don't worry the dial that shows you how much is left used miniscule power, or as it says in the manual it would take 1,000,000 shakes to use up the battery.Having three charging ports is great when I travel with an iphone and an iPad.12,000 mAh is a phenomenal amount if battery power that lasts through multiple charging cycles of my devices, and since it lives in my backpack and doesn't get used everyday the battery should last me a while before it requires a recharge.My only wish, and this is for ANY addon device, would be to have a lightning plug input option for charging so that I don't have to carry around a micro USB and my iphone lightning cable.

    Rating: 5

    2014-03-10: To begin, I was quite impressed with this product. Considering how much power it holds, it's fairly lightweight and compact.It's 12000mAh capacity was enough to charge my iPhone5s over four time, and the fact that it's got three ports allows you to charge multiple devices while on the go.This particular model has three ports:1x "Smart" port that provides 2.4A and optimizes for whatever device to plug in to it.2x "Universal" ports that provide 2A.The Smart port will provide the fastest charges for both phones and Tablets, but the Universal ports still provide a charge that is plenty fast. The 12000mAh pack itself is charged by using a microUSB cable (included), you'll need to plug it into either an AC USB adapter, or into your computer. A 1.5A adapter is recommended and would result in a ~8-9 hour charging time from 0-Full while charging the pack with your computer would take over a day.Once you've plugged in your devices, give the Anker pack a little shake to begin charging. The LED ring in the middle will indicate how much power remains in the battery pack. It's a cool little design.I was provided this product to review and share my honest opinion/feedback.That being said, I have no complaints about this product and think it's a great buy.It's very competitively priced, and works very well.You don't realize how useful being able to charge your phone or tablet without a nearby outlet is until you've got used to it!Highly recommended.

    Rating: 5

I have had a number of opportunities to use this charger and could not be more pleased. The 12000mAh unit charges my iPad Mini, iPhone, GPS, and others with plenty of juice to spare.

    2014-01-14: Call me a geek, but I love external batteries. I've been in places and in conditions where I would have loved to have one. So now I have several, including the Anker Astro Pro2 20000mAh Ultra-High Capacity Multi-Voltage (5V 12V 16V 19V) External Battery for my laptop and the Anker Astro E4 13000mAh for my cell phone, iPod, and other necessities. Why did I buy the Astro3 12000mAh External Battery? Two reasons - (1) additional power is always a good thing because (2) my kids tend to steal my cool stuff, like batteries (I guess I raised them right!). It's very sleek to the touch; a trend I'm noticing in recent Anker products. Three ports, including a "Smart Port" which just doesn't care what you plug in (Apple or Android), it will recharge it. It's not that large or heavy and can stand upright if needed. There are no external buttons, which leads to my only criticism. I understand minimalism, but I really don't like the "shake to wake" requirement. It's a little silly - I just hope I don't accidentally throw it at someone during a shake! Also, I really liked the flashlight on the Astro E4 13000mAh and wish the Astro3 12000mAh had one as well. Other than that, it's a great battery for the price! - See more at: [...]

    2013-12-22: The buttonless feature sounded great when I purchased it, now its getting a little annoying.The shake part needs quite a jolt to get it going, so if you have it in a small pocket of your bag, you need to almost get the whole thing out to shake to turn it on.     2014-04-21: This is my second product from Anker, the first being their 14 watt solar panel which is an outstanding performer, and a great value compared to similar products from competitors. I purchased the 2nd Gen Astro3 as a backup charger for my Samsung Galaxy S4 in case of emergencies, natural disasters, etc. I decided to test this unit to see how many times it would charge my phone, so I first fully charged the Astro3, then ran the Galaxy S4 (2600 maH battery) down to 5% remaining charge each time and recharged it with the Astro3 until the phone was at 100%. I was able to get the S4 to the 100% level three times, and on the fourth, to 74%. Anker states in it's description that the Astro3 will charge " large-capacity phones like the Galaxy S4 almost four times", so that appears to be a fair claim, and an excellent result. Each full charge from 5% to 100% took about 1 hour and 50 minutes using the included 5 pin micro USB cable. The Astro3 looks, feels, and performs like a high quality product, and IMHO is a great value as well.

    2013-11-14: Initially I am really impressed this portable charger. I have one used it a few time and only to partially charge my iPhone 5. Charging times are not fantastic, but it get the job done. My iPhone charges much faster while plugs into a wall, but a lot slower than this while plugged into my car. The only downside as some people might suggest is that with every little movement the light circle lights up. As a result, if you are walking or have this in a backpack the light circle will continually stay on. As far as I can tell it has not affected the battery life, but I've only had a couple weeks. Overall great device and in my mind a much better alternative to a Mophie.

    2013-12-01: First, I have not used this heavily - YET. I have some international travel planned soon and it's going with me.I have, however, taken it through TSA security twice. Technically, it exceeds their lithium-ion battery capacity limit if you look on the TSA web site. But... if you read that page carefully, it really sounds like it is up to the TSA agents to decide what to do. They didn't even pause when my backpack went through.It's very cool looking. The lack of buttons is pretty neat. My only complaint is that it lights up all the time. When you move it just a little, it lights up. This could give the impression that it turns on all the time and cause concern, for example, with TSA. I would almost prefer a switch or a button to turn it and off.Otherwise, compact - full of juice - good looking.

    2013-08-28: I am amazed at the quality of this battery, very fast load all my phones, the quality of the materials improved a lot with respect to the previous generation. If you want the best battery, buy this.

    Rating: 5

    2013-08-15: Anker gave me this product in exchange for my honest feedback, so I'll do my best to write an accurate, unbiased review.Perhaps I got a dud or substandard unit, but I haven't gotten my spanking new 12Ah Astro 3 to charge my ipad3 more than 75% before running out of juice. With the iPad 3 battery capacity being around 11,600 mAh, this equates to about a 27% loss through conversion, much lower efficiency than is advertised.I'm also getting less iPhone 5 charges than other users at 5 full charges, which is still good, btw. It has 3 charging ports, (one of them intelligent) whereas most batteries in this class only have 2, and bridged ones at that.Fit and finish are excellent - rubber coating provides good grip and the carrying bag is a nice padded mesh pocket.For me, the Shake to charge/status is a mixed bag, as it is a novel idea, but I'm wondering how much energy is wasted by the indicator getting lit up while getting bumped all day in your bag or pocket.It was a nice surprise that the micro-USB to 30-pin adapter was included, however it is so small that I can see it getting lost very easily. Also, the short USB to micro USB cable gets very HOT when charging that battery itself, even using Anker's which leads to the next critique, that of charging time. It was good that Anker did not include some cheap cube power adapter, as charging from one of those would be glacially slow. Plugged into Anker's own 18w 3.6A charger, it still took longer than expected to charge the battery from dead, at approximately 10-12 hours.Pros:* 3 charging ports,1 intelligent, simultaneous charging of all three* Fit and finish* 10-segment charge statusCons:* Wasted energy from shake to charge/status* Only 1 cord/tip included* Can't charge and use battery at the same time* Slow charging of battery itselfOverall, I like this battery a lot, though I'm reluctant to give it a full 5 stars based on some of the performance that I've seen so far.

    Rating: 4

I absolutely love the convenience of it and have used it to charge the things I listed in the title.

    2013-10-16: This product has absolutely met and exceeded my expectations. If you are looking for several recharges (at least on phones and some tablets) and the ability to charge multiple devices then this portable battery will leave you very pleased. The "Smart" USB port apparently charges at the maximum amps possible for your device so it charges my phone (Galaxy Nexus) VERY quickly. I kind of want to say that it almost seems to charge my phone faster than a normal power outlet, but I am not sure that is possible.If I had to think of "negatives"... It's kind of bigger, but I bought it for it's charging capacity. Most other 12000 mAh batteries are about the same size. This one at least looks sleek and delivers. Also it doesn't have a built in cable, but it DOES come with a mesh case that I didn't know about from reading the description. Included was a short micro usb to USB cable as well that works fine for my phone.I did shop around a bit before buying this... at least virtually shopped. There are some good alternatives that might be the same cost or save you some money, but I think what the alternatives lack is 3 ports and the 4A total charging capability. I saw one or two other units that had other perks like being waterproof and maybe slightly lighter, but they lacked the AMPS and/or number of ports of this device.Find what works for you, but I don't think you will be unhappy with this.Oh, and I did email Anker since I was concerned about there being no power switch and how that would affect it coming on constantly. They wrote back very promptly and said that the device would come on occasionally, but the amount of power used would be EXTREMELY low as long as there was no device connected that was charging. Sounds good to me.

    2013-10-03: OK, like most everyone else, I have many devices that need to be recharged on a regular basis. Whether at school, work, out camping for a week - whatever...In the past I have used (and loved) other Anker products, so much so that they are my primary/only brand I shop for backup power.This is a must buy, and below is my reasons why:First - it is up to you to make sure that this (or any other power supply) will work with and for your device(s)~! The Aker website has a message-board where you can ask about your specific product if you are not sure[...]This item will only charge 5 volt devices.The 2nd Gen Astro3 has three (3) USB ports that you can use at the same time.This unit has the greatest ability to charge multiple devices at the same time.A great warranty of 18 months, fast and easy support and a super great price, all combined with wonderful Amazon service - can't ask for any better~!

    Rating: 5

    2014-02-26: he devices charged as if they were plugged into the normal chargers. I had high expectations with most of the reviewer's stating they were getting high 70 to low 80% of the 12000 mah. I am not sure if it has more to do with the lightning charger for the iphone 5 and ipad mini cause more charge to be lost.

    Rating: 5

    2013-12-03: This is one of those items that seems like a great idea because of its high capacity claims. Unfortunately, the one I received would never fully charge. I ended up replacing it with two 5,000mAh chargers which seem to provide the same total charge and greater flexibility.

    Rating: 2

    2014-06-27: I was the envy of my fellow travelers with a whopping 12 Amp-hours of juice in reserve while flying outdated airplane seats without charging plugs. Well, doubtful all 12,000mAh are going to go towards being able to binge watch half of a Television Show season on a trip, but it's still enough to recharge an iPhone 5 at least four or five times over.It's worth recognizing that it takes a lot more energy to get a battery from, say, 70% to 100% than it does to get it from 30% to 70%. Definitely get more screen time if I just use it to bump from red to 70% than to take it all the way to 100.

    Rating: 5

    2014-01-22: I purchased this for on the road charging with my culinary jobs and conferences. Very straight forward and the simple light on the system telling me the amount of charge left or staus of charging worked perfectly. A simple shake and it was good to go with information.Simply the best portable battery pack I've ever owned. I was able to keep the iPad charged up all day along with the iPhone.     Rating: 5

    2014-01-19: Anker 2nd Gen Astro3 12000mAh Portable Charger Backup External Battery World's-Fastest (4A Output) Triple-Port Shake-to-Wake Highest-Energy-efficiency Power Pack for iPhone 5S, 5C, 5, 4S, iPad Air, iPads, Samsung Galaxy Tablets, other Android Smart Pho...I bought this unit over the holidays to replace an existing battery that I have had several years. I originally wanted the Anker 2nd Gen Astro2 9000mAh model cause I was worried about the size of this thing as it lives in my daily Timbuk2 bag but when I finally went to buy it it was out of stock :-(What to do, what to do?I think what sold me on this was the fact that it has 3 charging ports on it :-) for me that is my Note3, Kindle Paperwhite (version2)and a Nexus7 tablet all at the same time if need be. I can also charge my Note3 and another device if in a social setting. Regardless, I don't think I'm ever going to need all of this but I have it!The reason this gets 5 stars is because unlike my original battery pack needing a special charge cable, this unit does not, you can charge it with any old micro USB cable or car charger. Very handy especially when traveling. I love it!!!When you get the device and take it out of the box it helps to charge the unit till thr round white disk on the unit glows a solid white, it is basically the battery level indicator. Once charged you can always see what the status of the battery is by either shaking the unit slightly which turns that gauge on or by touching it.As far as the ports are concerned here is the breakdown of what they are:Two of the ports are universal ports that are capable of charging most devices up to 1.5 Amps.The Third port is Smart meaning it charges up to 2.4 Amps, using smart chip technology to detect the USB pin signals and identify the device, then auto-adjusting the output to suit.Unlike my previous battery there are no buttons on this unit, plug your device into this battery and it begins to charge it. There is no questioning is it on? Its on...And because it uses a standard micro USB cable to recharge the battery itself as an other reviewer on YouTube stated you can plug the battery into a car charger to charge it while plugging your phone or tablet into the battery to charge them, then while charging if you need to shut the engine off say your going into a store, you can still charge your phone or tablet. (for cars where the cigarette lighter shuts off when the key is pulled).Some users have complained about the size of the unit and the weight but to be honest, it is no bigger or heavier that my last battery unit, the size and weight really don't bother me at all. I don't even notice it.Cons:The pouch it comes with is Super tight and it difficult to put the battery into it. I don't even use it. The finish on the battery prevents scratching so I hardly see a need for it.Versatile, simple to use, easy.

    Rating: 5

    2013-11-15: I was worried this thing was going to be a behemoth compared to my Anker Astro 2. But it really wasn't all that much bigger and offered 3 USB ports and more power.I love the read out, though, it does keep displaying bc its constantly being knocked around when traveling. But it wasnt bothersome to me.I only wish it included a light like the Astro 2 did. This would have been perfect.I highly recommend!

    Rating: 5

    2014-03-26: Can't go wrong with this unit! We use this to power two phones and a tablet. Shout out to Ingress for causing us to need this battery pack. There are two versions of this unit, black and white. From what I understood the black one has a port that is specific for apple devices, while the white version has three ports that can fully power android devices up to 4 A.This package comes with a little bag for the battery and a USB cable to charge your Android devices with or the battery pack itself.There is no charger included with this unit, so if you don't have a fast charge already, make sure you pick one up! Charging time takes a long time. How long? Take into consideration how long it takes to charge your phone or devices battery... then compare how many times bigger this battery is... multiply time accordingly and that is an estimate.

    Rating: 5

    2014-05-29: this is my second large capacity Anker that i am returning. will not recharge. The smalll units work fine, but so far I've had to return two 12000Ah's. :-( so disappointed because I really love this brand. Will try another brand for 12000 or over and see how my luck goes.

    2014-07-15: Charges at advertised specs. Small, light and built well like all Anker products. Recharges from 20%, off a 5v/2amp port in around 5-6 hours. The remains power meter lights are easy to read, accurate and well segmented. The shake to start feature is nice, but you need to remember to shake it lightly. It recharges fairly cool to the touch. I am able to get 3 recharges simultaneously to a iPhone 5s and iPad mini retina from 20-25% remaining back to 100%. This will leave me around 2 bars remaining on the batteries power meter. If the is one draw back to the unit it's that it will not pass through charge while charging itself.

    Rating: 5

    2014-01-26: I carry this around as a spare power source for my Zerolemon Note 3 10,000mah. The Pack itself will hold its charge extremely well for weeks or longer. The whole pack is good for an entire charge of the 10k battery under use. The smart port and the onboard power chip are a great combo, It is still more efficient than any Mophie pack I have owned (Many), and it prevents overcharge, and conditions the battery with normal use. It charges quickly (overnight) when paired with a good 2.1A charger.I compared this directly with the Mophie Juicepack Pro Duo 6000mah which was double the cost retail, I no longer have it, because I kept the Anker pack; @ a lower pricepoint without a sale, double the capacity and an extra port made this decision a no brainer.With the stock battery on my note 3, I was able to get a good 3 days use when paired with this pack, good for 2.5+ charges on the 3200mah battery. With the ZeroLemon 10k, the Anker Astro3, and my Note 3, I only stop to charge them both ONCE a WEEK, even under constant use, with minimal power management.

    Rating: 5

    2014-06-23: This battery is always in my bag, and has saved my bacon more than a few times.It is one of the few that can go to work on a nearly dead phone and give it the current needed to charge it while using it, all the way to top-off. Most smaller batteries would peter out or pump low current, but this Anker puts 1500mA into the phone.The CABLE is critically important to get all the available current, and it would be great if Anker would include a high-current charge cable with these batteries. Most of the microUSB cables I have are not up to the task, but this battery is.

    2013-09-05: This product is a life saver . i been using now for a weeks and the extra power is very nice . very portable and reliable

    Rating: 5

    2014-04-26: The unit has some weight to it, and the enclosure has a slight tacky touch, which prevents slipping out of your hand. It comes with a mesh pouch, nice touch there for us traveling folks. I am not so thrilled about the shaking function to activate the charger; I would rather just have a plain on-off switch. It holds charge very well and is capable of charging multiple products all at once. It cannot be charged while charging other devices, which I thought it's odd and not very convenient. The lack of this feature knocks a star out of the gate. I note that if I charge my Bose BT headset by alone, the charger would turn off after a while, even though the Bose has not been fully charged... I think that there must be is a minimum load on the charger to keep it up and running. The Bose really draws very little current, and unless I keep shaking the charger from time to time, I will not get my Bose to be fully charged. This goes away if I connect additional devices to the charger... then everything gets charged fully... the unit will eventually turns itself off, but at that point, I am not sure if the charger goes into trickle charge or it just turns off....What I like: multi-ports to charge multi devices; well built; carrying pouchWhat I don't like: shaking function to activate; different current rating for different ports (Anker should just use the IQ technology and distribute the power to the ports on demand and as needed, like all other products they make)

    2014-06-18: If you're active and out and about doing things, this is not the battery pack for you. I throw this in my duffle bag, work bag, golf bag. But the tradeoff for that is that you can charge most devices at full speed, just as if they were plugged into the wall. For me this is worth it. I've purchased many portable battery "packs" only to plug my phone in to charge, and I realize it doesn't actually charge anything. Sometimes they just extend your phone battery with the complete charging process taking almost a full 8 hours. Anker really made a quality product here, fitting such a large capacity battery in such a compact form. I also like to see how much power it has left in 10 percent increments. Some cheaper batteries will give you 3 or 4 lights and be like "yeah each light means 25% or 33% power". What the crap is that. I hate having to guess just tell me. No matter what device you own be it android ipad windows phone or blackberry this get you powered through the whole day and more. Great product

    2013-07-27: UPDATE 2/15/2014My smart port stopped working. No reason or anything.     Rating: 1

    2013-07-28: Yes, another external battery. No, this one is like nothing I have ever tested from Anker or anybody else. It's not a surprise Anker became one of my favorite companies to review new products from because they are constantly introducing something new and/or improved. That is the only way to stay on top of the game and to earn the top rating of your customers.First of all, even with it's 12000 mAh capacity, this new 2nd gen Astro shrank up in size down to 110 mm x 83 mm x 26 mm which fits very comfortably and feels very nice with its soft touch rubbery finish in your hand. At close to 10 oz in weight you will feel it for sure in your pocket, although it's slick design is very portable and with included mesh pouch is easy to carry around in your bag/purse/backpack or even pants pocket, as long as you are not wearing skinny jeans :) In contrast to most of the today's external batteries with dual output, Astro 3 comes with 3 independent full size usb outputs that deliver a whooping 4A of combined current. I checked it by charging Note 2, S4, and Nexus 7 simultaneously and was able to confirm that right on a dot. N2 was charging at about 2A, S4 at about 1A, and N7 at about 1A as well. I was actually timing and monitoring the percentage of battery change, not just relying on Current Charge app. These 3 usb charging outputs are actually partitioned into one Smart output (intended for Apple devices and other android devices) and two Universal outputs which are specifically designed to charge Android devices at maximum speed. There is some custom circuit which determines max speed and optimizes output correspondingly. I also noticed the safety nature of this circuit prevented me from charging both N2 and S4 at 2A each from Universal outputs where N2 was charging at 2A and S4 at 1A, leaving 1A for Smart output, thus confirming it's not a bulk current sharing between all 3 ports. The input port, micro-usb, for charging Astor 3 is actually a fast 1.5A input which is great since it charges this external battery at 1.5x times faster rate.While you charging the battery itself or using to charge other devices, another huge improvement in the design is a circular 10-segment indicator with granularity of 10%. You no longer have to rely on a typical 4-segment led. This one will give you a more precise reading, although it might take you a little while to get used to figuring out on a spot the exact percentage by counting segments before light times out. Once the light turns off, it's a clean surface design with no leds or buttons. So how do you turn it on or verify led count? Yet another cool innovation, just do a shake of the battery and indicator circle turns on to reveal number of active segments. I really like that motion activated switch, makes it very unique. But trust me, it's not the most unique part of this new Astro 3 design. As I mentioned in a number of my previous reviews, the labeled capacity of the battery is not what you actually get. It's the capacity of the cells inside of external battery when it has to be converted to 5V usb interface at the output and then back from 5V to 3.7V inside of the phone. During this conversion ALL external batteries loose anywhere between 30%-35% of its capacity. Well, this new 2nd gen Astro 3 is optimized to a much higher efficiency. I have tested it and can confirm it provides the actual charging capacity of 10,044 mAh, which means a loss of only 16%!!! Basically, the internal battery circuit has been optimized to provide a more efficient output. I have tested a lot of external batteries, and this is the first one I have seen at such high efficiency.Overall, I was very impressed with a design and features of this battery, especially with how efficient it's output. For $49.99 on Amazon its a great value where it provides the actual capacity output equal to other more expensive batteries labeled at around 14000 mAh. With a high output efficiency, 4A of total combined charging current, triple output, and motion activated 10-segment led indicator - I highly recommend it!

    Rating: 5

    2013-08-06: Got this as a gift for a friend and he's really liking it. Charges his tablet and 2 phones as AC with no problem. Just a heads up this uses a standard USB to power adapter (Android phone one worked fine) but does not have one included.

    Rating: 5

    2013-08-02: An iPhone is only good if it has enough power and nowadays with battery-draining applications and alike, the battery is seemingly much less and can barely get through a day. The new ANKER Astro 3 is the perfect solution for this widely accepted issue with not only Apple products but with nearly any electronic device. After having and using this device for the past week, I can easily confirm that it provides up to 7 FULL 1-100% charges for my iPhone 5. Some external batteries market these kinds of numbers, but this 12,000mAh monster owns up to its promise.The Anker 2nd Gen Astro3 is perfect solution - it is affordable, durable, and most definitely useful. The device comes pre-charged out of the box and only takes about 6-8 hours from my experience to gain a substantial amount of charge again. One unique feature with this device is that it comes with 3 USB outs. Most external batteries only have 2, but this device has been able to accommodate 3 which allows you and your friends to all charge at once. Not only will you like sharing but your friends will be impressed with your "nifty-ness"!Over the past two days, I along with 3 other friends were at the beach. The Anker Astro3 provided all 4 of us with charged iPhones (2 iPhone 5s and 2 iPhone 4S's) for the course of 2 entire days! Amazing! We were all satisfied with how well this device charged in a matter of minutes. Putting the devices into Airplane mode made the Astro a rocket in boosting the batteries for our phones. The Astro3 was definitely something we would not have been able to live without as all our phones would've been dead the first day on the beach.Not only can the Anker Astro3 charge iPhones but it can also charge full-fleshed iPads and other battery-driven tablets. Being an iPad 4 owner, I can comment on how well this little power pack can charge the entire tablet in a matter of hours WHILE charging my other devices such as my iPhone and camera. This "all at once" feature is so useful and definitely something that is used a lot.This device encompasses some unique features within it as well. Firstly, it has a circular dial that powers up with LED lights to indicate how much percentage is remaining to the 10th of the percentage - this is much better than having to the 25th of a percentage like other devices. Additionally, the device powers on when the user shakes it so it is not losing any power when it is not being used. Lastly, the entire Astro3 is is built from a sturdy, sleek material which can easily fit into your pocket. It feels good to hold and is smooth to the touch - the matte design is simply mind-blowing.Overall, I have no complaints for this device - it is powerful in every single way. From its sleek design principles to the actual usefulness of the external battery, I am more than impressed by how well it can handle multiple devices charging at once. Anker has really outdone themselves again this time. Their customer service and product management teams both should be proud of this device that they now offer. I highly recommend this to anyone looking for an external battery pack for their electronic USB powered devices.I was supplied a sample for test and evaluation, and I promised that my review is fair and honest. No intention of a positive review was expected by Anker.

    Rating: 5

    2013-11-17: This is an awesome little toy for your iPhone 5, but obviously with limitations - you can't expect Carl Zeiss technology for this price after all.You get a fisheye lens, a wide angle lens and a macro lens in a device the width of your phone. The lens caps have a mind of their own and disappear into thin air.Otherwise, it's portable and quick to attach, and comes in very handy when taking architectural photos or landscapes to send to friends or post online.   • B000KK1MAC

    $B000KK1MAC

    A great description that explains what this product is all about. Here's what you get!

    2011-04-23: There is a real dearth in the market for a decent stylus/pen for the iPad. The pen works fine, the rubber tip provides reasonable responsiveness, but the cap can be easily lost and the pen is too thin for my taste. I use this product on a daily basis, but don't expect to be blown away by its functionality.

    Rating: 3

    2013-11-06: Great item for those of us with iPads who also need to scribble a note the old fashion way. I never leave home without my iPad and this most useful stylus.

    Rating: 5

    2011-03-04: This stylus is wonderful to use, when it's new. It glides very nicely over the screen. In my experience, however, as it gets older, or perhaps as it picks up oils from the screen and skin, it gets more "sticky". In a few months, it is so sticky it won't write smoothly. It is also fairly expensive for what you get.

    Rating: 4

    2011-06-20: I use this to draw diagrams and sketches using OmniGraffle for iPad, and various whiteboard style collaboration software on the iPad. It is a much better experience drawing things with this pen, then using my finders. Positioning is much more refined and accurate.The pen is relatively heavy and gives a quality feel.Only complaint is, it seems pretty expensive for what it is. I wish it is $10 cheaper.

    Rating: 3

    2011-09-28: Making a stylus that also functions as a pen is a great idea! Now I don't have to carry both in my pocket and look geeky. One suggestion that I would like to make is that the pen cap be able to fit on the other end when writing, just like most pens with a cap. I am concerned about losing the cap and then the clip for the pocket is gone too. A small design change would make this a great product!

    Rating: 4

    2011-04-09: Previous experience:Pogo SketchTargus stylusEDIT:This stylus is awesome! No degradation in performance over time as you get with the foam tipped units. Good for writing, drawing and pressing buttons. Pen works well.*Note: If you want to save money, the Targus and Griffin stylus are identical to this one. This one just has a pen built in and is MUCH nicer in terms of quality and build of product. Functionality is the same though.Just bought the Boxwave in my quest for the best stylus. This one has the rubber soft tip which I like better than the foam. I think the rubber tipped styli show more of an effort in development rather than the left over circuit foam styli that might as well tell you that you're not worth the R&D; (pogo).Out of the box this thing feels like a small to medium sized pen. It actually is an ink pen on one end and a stylus on the other. With regard to dual function styli, I like this one because the pen is capped and when you are not using it, the cap adds to the body of the stylus as if there is no separate piece.Looks great too.I have to compare it to the Targus or Griffin one because that's the closest in similarity. It does seem to be slightly more sensitive than the Targus, not deal breaker sensitive but depending on what application you are using, it could mean the difference between smooth writing and less than smooth writing. (your hand weight, writing pressure and writing style make a difference too). It's about a half an inch longer than the Targus, which gives it some nice pen like feel in your hand.This feels more like a pen than the Targus does, and while that has to do with the fact that it actually is an ink pen as well, it's also to do with construction of the item.On tests using Penultimate, Upad, Paperdesk, Note Taker HD, and Neu.notes I found the boxwave to perform very well and objectively better than the targus. However, I think at this point that all "rubber" tipped styli will perform similarly and it might come down to which device feels the best in your hand. As with ink pens, how the item feels is just as important and can play a role in quality of writing as how it actually writes. In this case, both the ink pen and the stylus function work well and do their job properly. I am overall pleased with this but I am reserving jumping jacks for a few weeks of use to see how it performs after some wear.In comparison to the pogo, there is no comparison. This to the pogo is like a ferrari to a yugo. The pogo being the yugo. I would not mind if the boxwave came in a slimmer barrel and had aluminum anodized colors, but I will likely never go back to a foam tip.Saying that though, I have to say as before, your writing style will dictate which type of stylus is right for you. If given the chance, get one of each and see what works better or try them out in the store. Had I done that with the foamies, I would have stayed away, but I can see that they would work for some people.I think the price I paid for this stylus is good, but I would not pay more since I really do believe now that the rubber tip is going to be pretty much the same. Unless you pay more for aesthetics do not pay more because you believe the tips will be different, they won't be. Griffin, Targus and Boxwave rubber tipped styli are identical even down to the silver metal band that holds the tip to the barrel. Identical.I would, and probably will buy another Boxwave stylus.Pros:Good weightVery nice construction and materialsQuality feel over other brands, doesn't feel like a generic stick, actually feels like thought went into it.Ink is refillable with standard store bought refills. Included ink works well but is clearly genericMetal barrel with metal ink head. Dual O-rings on ink end prevent debris from entering barrel and keep cap tightCons:None really. Only wish the cap could be fit over the stylus when using the ink pen, but that would create a design issueWill update if I find any issue during use.

    Rating: 5

    2013-05-29: Purchased this to maintain a charge towards the end of the day on my Motorola Droid 4. If my phone is completely dead it will bring it up to about 80% but this is only a matter of which battery is bigger. This little battery pack holds a very good amount (1860mAh rated) for its size.The additional USB output port is a nice feature too to charge another phone, bluetooth earpiece or iPod even. The attached USB cable works perfect on my phone and isn't loose by any means so once it is in and connected, it stays that way.The indicator lights and power on/off button seem to get the job done, no complaints there really, and the charger that comes with this battery back is a generic Motorola charger that works well and charges the pack up in a decent amount of time.

    Rating: 5

    2013-01-11: As others mention, this battery pack doesn't charge in a matter of seconds. However, in my case, it only took thinking ahead a bit. On a recent trip to NY after making calls, pulling up maps, checking Yelp reviews, etc my phone went dead in record time (and of course in the middle of a call). Having charged my Motorola battery pack the previous night, I was quickly able to connect again to the world. The built in cord connected phone and battery pack in just seconds. The phone was a little more cumbersome to use with the pack attached, but it was certainly preferable to no phone at all. Interestingly, the pack proved to increase the amount of time available by a multiple of 3 compared to my phone's stock battery. Back at the hotel I left the 2 devices connected and plugged in only the battery pack to the wall outlet. I was able to charge both devices at once even while periodically using the phone. Besides the phone, I've since used the pack to power / charge my Kindle Fire when it went dead while out and about. For me, the key has been getting in the habit of charging up the pack daily as I do my phone. With a not supplied mini USB to regular USB connection cord, I can also charge the pack from my laptop. Since this was cheaper than a 2nd phone battery, lasts longer than my regular phone battery and can be used for more than just phone battery backup, buying the pack made more sense.

    Rating: 4

The problems with it are as follows. The entire side of the unit is your answer and hang up button. If it starts to slip out of your ear and you push it back in, you hang up on your call. I got my wife one also and she hung up on someone three times, it is difficult to avoid. The volume control is unique others had an issue with it hanging up their calls and I can see that happing since you have to gently glide your finger up and down the side to control the volume, a little too much pressure and goodbye. To charge the unit or turn it off you must return it to the stone holder, the USB charge is on that device only, if you forget the base at home you cannot charge it while on the road or turn it off. The other problem I have with it taking it out of the stone base is supposed to turn it on and activate it, I had to place it back in the base and remove it three times to get it to turn on. This has not been an uncommon problem for me, I called tech support and they told me to exchange it. I would like to see Jabra take the over all design and lose the stone piece place a usb connector and a real on off switch with a more pronounced answer key. Not sure how they would design it but the comfort of this headset is better than any I have tried. I also purchased the Jabra Extreme to try and that is a very good headset, I can write more about it later but the extreme like other headsets begins to hurt your ear after you have been wearing it for an extended time.     2013-01-09: The instructions are slightly confusing due to an imperfect translation. Following them did not work for me. It said to tilt the phone and insert the left side first, then the right side. Doing so squished the silicone layer between the cracks, making it impossible to apply.Instead, I devised my own way of putting on the skin. I took off the silicone layer, putting that on first, then putting the hardshell layer on afterwards. You'll then have to make adjustments and wiggle around the skin so all the holes and phone buttons line up exactly. It takes a few minutes to get it all right. After that, the volume buttons and on/off toggle are easy to push and everything is as it should be.The skin wraps around part of the front of the phone as well, giving it some additional protection if placed facedown. I like the Thunderbolt flap. It protects the port from dust and other hazards.

I really liked the way the look seemed to compliment the iPhone with the black border and clear back on my white (Stupid company) iPhone so I went ahead and ordered it.I'll be honest, my expectations were low and I thought I'd get some cheap case that would hold up for a few weeks before starting to discolor or deform.NOPE!I'm extremely impressed with the overall build quality and feel of this case, it punches way above it's price point.The materials feel very high grade and have not shown any signs of discoloration since I've started using it. Impact protection, which is something they mention on this design, seems good as neither the case nor my phone have taken damage from couple of 'Out of Pocket Experiences' that occurred with the case.All ports and buttons are easily accessible, button coverings for power and volume buttons are firm but perfectly functional while all ports on the bottom fit even my equipment mounts.Overall, this is a great low cost case that you won't feel that you skimped on while using it.I would consider this as a case for a personal phone, that is how impressed I am with the build quality and overall feel of the case.

    2014-05-29: I wanted a clear, non-bulky case, and after reading lots of reviews for lots of cases, I chose this one. It fits my iPhone 5c snugly, and I have easy access to the important features on the bottom of the phone, and the power & volume buttons work smoothly and without having to apply a ridiculous amount of pressure. I also have easy access to the silence button just above the volume controlsThe phone w/case fits in my back and front jeans pockets, which is important to me.I've dropped it twice, once on carpet and once on hardwood floor. It survived, but I don't know if the case had anything to do with it or not. The falls weren't from much height, and the landings were pretty soft.The rubber bumper provides a 2 or 3mm step that should protect the screen if the phone lands face down. I have a ZAGG screen protector on it, which helps protect the screen from scratches, etc., but probably not falls.The screen protector that came with the phone didn't seem adequate to me, but others might find it to be perfectly suitable.

    Rating: 5

    2013-11-14: I bought this to replace a Luvvitt mistake I made earlier. This case is perfect! It does not add much bulk to the phone and feels like it will offer very good drop protection. The buttons function easily & accurately. Many complaints I read before I purchased reference the clear back not being clear enough. Once I pulled the masking off both the inside & outside, the back was crystal clear. The masking had no visible edge to pull. I had to pick & scrape at the corner to get it off. I would guess that complaints regarding the back were due to the masking not being removed. Time will tell how well the back stays scratch free. Honestly, it is not that important to me. I worry more about drop protection.

    2014-07-05: it works good

    Rating: 5

    2014-03-24: i was skeptical about this product because it's priced so low, but i bought it and now that i've had this case now for several months and have been really impressed with how well it's designed. this case is really a great product for keeping your 5c protected. the air cushioned corners absorb shock really well, i've dropped it several times with no damage to my phone. I had a bumper case on my original 5c which boasted the same kind of lip feature that keeps the glass face from touching the surface that it's laid on, but one drop and my screen shattered. i went looking for a more protective case but products like otterbox completely cancel out the ability to carry a slim phone by adding a ton of bulk. this case is the perfect mix of protection but still keeps it relatively slim. the material is also worth mentioning. i like the shock absorbing cushion and "grippiness" of a silicone type case but hate that it doesn't slide into my pocket easily and is hard to wash off. this material is the perfect mix of soft silicone but also polished smooth surface so it never gets caught on my hair or stuck in my pocket and wipes down easily. and ESPECIALLY for the price! totally worth every penny! and YAY for the clear case to show off the fun colors! well done spigen!

    Rating: 5

The biggest design problem with the armband is that it covers the power and volume buttons. But this is lacking an LED light to let you know that it is sending power. That is a curse and a blessing to me. In this case, it is not too bad because the charger sits so snugly. But with other car chargers I've had, it's nice to know if you've knocked it lose. BUT the LED light can be a distraction if it is too bright. So I really don't miss it on this one.I've charged two devices at once using my USB cables and had no trouble at all. But I haven't plugged anything really tough into it.     2013-11-22: I am rating this based on my experience with the device, even though it's my wife's phone.Pros:- Excellent display screen- Super fast- Nice photos from camera- Amazing battery life- Cell reception is better that the galaxy SIII when side by side- 32gb storage internalCons:- Size, but this was expected, not great for most pockets.- Car charger that can do the 1.8 amps that the wall charger does is impossible to find. I will say though, once you accommodate yourself to it, it's pretty easy to work with since the phone is large. There also hasn't been any accidental volume changes or powering on the device, which is a plus. I accidentally hit the power and volume keys on my Galaxy SIII all the time.Since this is my wife's phone, I haven't used it as a daily driver, but the battery lasts all day (usually around 20% left by 6 pm), when her old Galaxy SIII would die by 2 pm. She uses it heavily for Facebook messaging and talks about 2 hours a day on it for her business.I would recommend this device to anyone who wants a fast device with a large screen.     Rating: 5

    2014-03-29: My wife absolutely loves this phone from Sprint. Replaced a Samsung Galaxy S2 with it. Only issue was that the phone was not activated directly in the mail as it claimed. We had to take the phone to a Sprint store to complete activation.

    Rating: 5

    2014-03-27: For some reason the double tap feature always makes me think of Harry Potter tapping twice on the Marauders Map and saying Mischief Managed. Corniness aside I absolutely love this phone. I really wanted the Samsung Galaxy S4 but it was sold out so I "settled" for this phone. Sometimes settling is a good thing.Like a lot of reviewers I thought the back power and volume buttons would be annoying but I love their placement. They're unobtrusive and never get in the way. I love the double tap feature and find myself tapping everything now and getting annoyed when it doesn't work. This double tap feature is so important to me now that I'm not sure I want a phone that doesn't have it.I didn't know that the phone did not have a removable battery or an SD card slot when I took it home but that has actually not bothered me at all. The 32 GB is plenty because all my music is in the cloud anyway and Dropbox automatically backups all my photos. It may be that in a few years when the battery has a problem I'll care more about it. Battery life right now is amazing and the phone charges really quickly. Yes GPS does suck power but I just keep it on the charger when using GPS. The phone is really responsive however it has frozen and rebooted a few times when I did something too fast.The other day out of the blue the screen brightness on the Kindle app kept changing from dim to bright so I powered the phone down and restarted it. When the phone restarted it looked just like it did when I first took it out of the box. It had the default Sprint apps displayed and all my carefully arranged apps had disappeared from the screens. I still had all my apps installed but they were no longer displayed. That was a very frustrating experience as it took a while to get everything back the way it had been. I did take the opportunity to acquaint myself with the Home Screen option in Settings where you can backup app/widget layouts and themes (Home backup & restore). If I had used this setting after first setting up my phone 3 months ago I would have saved myself a lot of aggravation.The size of the phone is perfect. I have very long fingers and smaller phones always fell out of my hands multiple times a day. This phone feels perfect in my hands and I can hold it and Swype with one hand. The biggest plus is that I have not dropped the phone once in the three months I've had it.I switched from Virgin Mobile and it was a very quick process for Tech Support to switch my number over to Sprint. The cell tower upgrade issues have been a huge pain but I finally get LTE continuously wherever I go now.The camera takes great pictures and is very easy and quick to use. The flash work well and I've taken some great pictures in the dark. The screen is beautiful. I like having a background picture on my text messages. The remote app is super useful as our main TV remote has buttons that don't respond any longer. I especially like the idea of changing the channel when my husband is hogging the remote during March Madness.TIP: For folks who hate losing their text messages when switching phones, the SMS Backup & Restore app is awesome for moving those text messages from your old phone to the new phone.

    Rating: 5

    2010-11-01: Captivate Travel Charger / B002M4NMWUI love my Captivate, but I've been having bad luck with chargers. I ordered one from AT&T;, but they don't send the same charger that comes WITH the phone (moon logic), and the one they DO sell causes my touch screen to complete freak out when I try to use the phone while plugged in. So does this model here -Samsung Captivate Wall Charger- the charger seems to work fine when plugged into a computer, but plug it into a wall and you can't use your phone *at all* while it's charging because the touch screen will register your fingers everywhere.I finally tried this charger -Samsung Travel Charger- and it works great, so I'm very pleased and relieved. The only drawback is that this is ONLY a wall charger - there's no detachable USB cord to hook into a computer. That's fine for work, because I wouldn't be hooking my phone up there anyway, but I do wish I could find a good wall charger that had full functionality. Still, I'm pleased with this charger and will probably order another one.~ Ana Mardoll
