    Rating: 5

    2012-08-03: I purchased the Anker Astro 5,600mAH External Battery after many hours of research spanning well over a year. I'd been tempted by the New Trents and a couple of others. Then recently, saw these Ankers and made the plunge after seeing the specs, reading the reviews, and seeing how involved the company was in providing suppport. I not only bought this item, but I also bought 2 x Astro 10,000mAh models. I've only had these 3 days, and have spent the majority of time testing the 5,600mAh model. I will compare more in future updates.First, I understood at purchase that the manufacturer stated a 30% loss due to various conversions. This means I can expect 3,920mAh of juice in real world use.I own a Galaxy Nexus phone. The phone is a battery hog. It comes with a stock 1,850mAh phone battery. With the Astro 5600, I should be able to charge my phone 2.12 times. Here are my initial test results.After depleting my phone battery to 0% and it shut off on its own:90% Charge after 1:20 (1 hour 20 minutes)100% Charge after 1:48Out of 4 bars, I had 2 left. But when I unplugged charger from phone, it jumped to 3 bars. Phone was left off until 90% charge. Then I kept screen off.After a second discharge to 1% and not letting phone shut off, but with screen off:100% Charge after 1:461 bar out of 4 remaining.After 3rd discharge to 10%, with screen off:38% Charge (Total of 20% actual charge) before Anker shut off.LED light still worked at least several hours after Anker stopped charging. I didn't see it stop since I went to bed.After a full discharge of the Anker 5600, it took about 6:50 to fully charge the battery back up using provided charger.The Anker 5600 performed exactly as I expected, capacity wise. It fully charges my Galaxy Nexus in under 2 hours.Compared to its bigger sibling, this device is near 1/3rd the size of the bigger model and yet has more than twice the capacity. It is the choice for charging mobility. I would not carry the big Astro 10,000 in my pocket! I could carry this one, but it is fat and does stick out in my slacks. I wish this were slimmer and wider.The Anker Astro 5600 is an all around winner. I'm more excited about this purchase than even the 10,000mAh version. The two of those I also purchased will be going to my kids and wife as they will not need it for discreet portability. They have a different purpose and I'll review them later.PROS:-Performs as stated-Charges phone fast for an external battery-Small in size-Holds a big charge for its size-Plastic, but seems durable-LED indicators seem accurate-Manufacturer warranty and support seems great (haven't used yet)CONS:-Fat, would be nice if half as thin-Takes almost 7 hours to fully recharge-Can only charge 1 device at a time-Finger print magnetNEUTRAL:-LED light can be handy, but not the best flashlight-Haven't had long enough to know if light turning on is an issue-Long term durability and life of battery unknown as of this review-Looks nice (subjective)

    Rating: 5

    2012-05-25: Great device!!! I travel a lot and new smartphones with large screens and faster processors eat batteries like crazy. This gadget comes in very handy and works with just about anything. I particularly picked this one over other models because of the 1 amp 5V output. Very happy with it and it feels well built and sturdy.

    Rating: 5

    2013-10-14: I change devices frequently and this product has out done itself. I use to purchase an external battery. But, since I now, change devices once a year to test and stay a head of my clients, I use this the Anker. Works how I expected it too.

    Rating: 5

    2014-03-31: This is my second Anker Astro 5600mAh Portable External Battery Charger and I bought this for a family member who was visiting and kept running her battery dead each day. Based on my first one which I have the product is great. I keep it charged and when going on trips or even out for a long day I take it so that I can boost my phone battery when it gets low. It is strong enough to recharge both mine and my wife batteries and still have a little bit left. The only problem with the second one is the little baggy that usually has all the cords was empty. We got only the cord to charge up the battery but nothing to charge the phones. Because my family member was leaving we did not have time to return and get another as she needed it for her trip home on long flights. I gave her a spare charge cord for her phone and it worked out for her but I am still a bit irritated we did not get the cords we were supposed to and yes while we could have gotten it replaced it would have meant not having it for the main purpose which was her return flight home. All in all a good product and if the need came up I would buy again but not if I was on a time crunch just in case I had to return for missing parts.UPDATE - Seems when I ordered my second Astro 5600 I used the old link and description and did not realize the additional cords were no longer included due to the large variety of possible devices this can be used for. My fault totally but Anker stepped up and apologized and made things right when they really did not have to. As I said before the battery itself is great and if I had another need I would not hesitate to buy this again.

    Rating: 5

    2013-09-03: I've been using my phone on international flights for reading books, listening to music, etc. I use this to charge it back up when it runs down. It gives me a little more than a full charge on a Galaxy Note 2 (which has a big battery already). I like that it uses the microusb connector to charge. No more carrying a separate power supply. Highly recommended if you're away from power a lot and need to keep your phone running.

    Rating: 2

    2011-09-26: I never used it to charge my phone from 35% yet. I have been using it at work around lunch time when the battery level drops to 84%. I am using this portable charger with my Samsung Epic 4G Touch (Samsung Galaxy S II). I call it "The Mighty Mouse Charger" because it is small, very portable but it is powerful at 5600mAH. The price is nice. I showed it to people they thought it cost more than the $49 I paid for it.This portable charger charges at the same rate as the AC charger that comes with the phone. I can take this charger everywhere I go, it can be placed in a pants pocket with a lot of room to spare. The Samsung Epic 4G Touch has a battery life of 12 to 13 for medium use. I am a heavy user, I use the internet, Netflix, play games/music. Netflix alone can drain your phone battery pretty fast if you watch a more for one hour. I am still testing it out. You have to charge it for four to five hours the first time you get it. After that it should last 3 to 4 days before you have to charge it again.This Anker Power Bank charger really comes in handy. I highly recommend it. Oh I had the New Trent iCruiser IMP1000 11000mAh External Battery Pack. It is 11,00mAh but it was too bulky too carry around without a backpack. I use to carry it in a hard drive case that had a belt loop. I sold it and got this one.

    Rating: 5

    2013-06-11: Very happy that this 5600mAh backup power/charger arrived just as described and on time with regular customer service check-ins from Anker Direct. Works will with the provided cables to charge my BlackBerry and iPad. Has a handy LED light also and four indicators showing capacity/strength.I have only used it to top up my BlackBerry Z10 as it sucks down battery and it performed well.

    Rating: 5

    2012-06-26: This small, pocketable spare battery/device charger worked perfectly for my last trip. It had enough juice to charge 3 empty smartphones on one charge, and it did so at 1 amp speed. The little flashlight included proved to be a little too eager to turn on in my pocket despite the double-tap required on the button, but that is a minor quibble. The included short and long USB cables with swappable tips are perfect. The system will also charge while charging a device, although if you're using micro-USB, you'll need another micro-USB-tipped cable.I might've wished for the slightly larger one, but for the price this was a very good value.

    Rating: 5

    2013-04-20: I've tried several portable battery chargers in the past and several of them have had lower charging capacities than advertised. This one seems to work very well, especially since it uses Samsung Grade A battery cells. It advertises to fully charge your iPhone 4S/4/3GS, battery capacity of about 1430 mAh, 2-3 times. I have an iPhone 5 with a battery capacity of 1440 mAh and it successfully charged my battery about 3 times.I decided to keep a log of how many times I charged my iPhone 5 on ONE FULL charge of the Anker 5600 mAh battery.Start: 5:48PM, 6% batteryEnd: 7:27PM, 100%, 3 bars remaining (out of 4)Start: 2:23PM, 34% batteryEnd: 3:44PM, 100%, 2 bars remainingStart: 9:50AM, 15% batteryEnd: 11:58AM, 100%, 2 bars remainingStart: 9:50PM, 1% batteryEnd: 10:13PM, 22%, 0 bars remainingSo you can see that it did as advertised and charge my iPhone 5 a little more than 3 times. I was using my iPhone 5 a little bit while it was charging, so that may compensate for not starting at 0% every single time. It took about 1.5 hours to fully charge my iPhone 5 when the battery pack was fully charged. It then took about 2 hours to fully charge my iPhone 5 when the battery pack was less than half charged.It was a little weird in the sense that even though it showed 2 bars remaining, it only charged my iPhone 5 about 21% before it died. Therefore, the battery status indicator isn't the most reliable.Overall, this portable battery pack is excellent. It's not too big. It looks sleek and it even has a handy LED light (although it's not that bright). It also comes with a bunch of charging tips, including an non-lightning iPod/iPhone/iPad tip. This is one of the more reliable and highly rated battery packs. Definitely recommend if you're looking for a cost-efficient battery pack.

    Rating: 5

    2013-08-24: So I purchased this product. I received it on time, as well as it being at a great price. The first day of having it, it was perfect. I charged it once and used it. However, when I went to charge it a second time, I plugged the cord in,and I went to bed. So when I woke up the next morning, to my surprise it wasn't charged. I started messing around with the cord and noticed it will only charge if the cord is bent down, and not all the way in. I thought it was just a cheap cord and tried it on multiple other cords and the same thing happened. If I have the cord plugged all the way in, and having it straight in the hole, it won't charge. Also I tried to bend the cord upwards, and it won't charge either. I do not know if the part where you plug it into, is defective or what, but I wish I didn't have to do this. I love the flashlight feature, and it holds about 3 charges. I would have easily given the product 5 stars but because I have to charge it this way, 1 star is due. I feel that having to charge it this way is totally unsafe. I noticed the product comes with a 18-month warranty. So if I have to do this everyday with the product, I am greatly debating about getting a replacement. I just wish I didn't have to deal with any hassle of the product not working right.

    Rating: 3

    2012-02-22: I live on my Droid X2 phone. Charge it overnight and keep it on charger in the car and, when I remember, around the house (I am retired, so no workplace to charge it at).Constant use for phone, text, email and internet - - the Droid doesn't last long when not on the charger despite power saving apps. So, I have taken to carrying a rechargeable battery pack.My first one was a Radio Shack Enercell. It was a weak contender. Fully charged, it could only raise the phone battery 20% (e.g., 50% to 70%). I lived with it, until it died after 8 months (I will have to take that up with Radio Shack, later).Today, I received this unit - - ordered after I read the positive reviews.It came well charged, three out of four bars. I charged it for three hours, until all four bars lit solid and plugged it into my Droid which was at 40%. An hour or so later, the Droid was fully charged and, yet, the Anker still showed its four bars. Of course, I knew that it must have used some power to resuscitate the Droid.However, I immediately plugged it in to my wife's LG Cosmo which was down to its three out of four bars and was due for a charging. To make this second event even more challenging, I turned on the flashlight function while the phone was charging.Then, I began writing this review.While the phone continues to charge, let me tell you a bit about the included cables and adapters. There are two cables, a 6 inch and a 24 inch (measurements are nominal) and seven adapters. The adapters include the male micro that is needed to charge the Anker and, coincidently, the Droid X2. The other adapters would be useful in charging a plethora of devices. I recognized a male mini adapter, an older Motorola adapter, the adapter that fits my Garmin, a circular input adapter plus others that I did not recognize.The cables and adapters are all white and I assume this is a marketing strategy to match some of the intended devices' original wires. Weird, as the device itself is an attractive shiny Black. I would prefer black cables and adapters, but that does not detract from the unit.I already entered an Amazon order for black cables that do not require adapters. I selected both 6 inch and 12 inch lengths, which I feel are optimal for my intended mode of use. I already have numerous examples of any other length(s) I might need on a frequent basis.The supplied cables and adapters, however, will be kept close at hand for those inevitable occasions when family,friends or strangers need an electronic boost for devices other than those using the micro connection. I think I will be the hero quite often! Maybe, at some point in time, I will need them for an oddball device of my own (but, not for my Kindle as it uses the same micro connector).Just under an hour since I started charging the LG (with the flashlight consuming power, as well) and two things happened virtually at the same time:The LG showed fully chargedThe Anker display dropped to only three barsThe flashlight remained bright throughout.I am thrilled with this initial performance. Extrapolating from these results, I estimate that I could get AT LEAST two complete charges for my Droid (as a retired teacher of mathematics, I love making these sorts of imputed calculations) which would last me 24+ hours of use between tethered charges (in the real world) that would be at least two days assuming the phone was not used in any way while I sleep.Alternatively, I could use the phone normally and as a night clock for a day and a half on a camping trip or during a power failure.Physically, the unit is compact and not unattractive (not that I care). It seems well built and seems durable.Its only shortcomings, as far as I can see is the horrible insert that serves as an instruction sheet. Good thing that its use is intuitively obvious and relatively trivial (old math explanation for something that you don't want to explain in a proof).Also,there are two variations of this unit on the market with different capacities and designs. You should investigate all of them and pick the one that seems to meet your projected needs.Five Stars and worth them!!!AFTER THREE MONTHS:WOW! Continues to amaze, I am never without power. What more can I say?Had a technical question and customer service provided, not only an answer, but great support.

    Rating: 5

    2013-06-15: liked it so much, i bought two. bought the first one last summer for myself and picked up another for my wife a couple of weeks ago. this is really such a handy charger. i have an evo 4g LTE from sprint. i travel frequently and tend to watch a lot of movies and shows on my phone. with the charger connected, i am able to squeeze bw 7-8 hours of playtime when the charger is fully powered. would have given it five stars for its storage capacity, size, and weight. it gets 4 stars because the off switch is not very responsive and usually requires several attempts to power off the unit and flashlight which inadvertently gets turned on each time you try to hit the power button.

    2012-12-02: There are many detailed reviews about this product; mine simply adds another '5 star' rating which is well deserved. Performs as advertised and comes with a nice selection of cables/adapters that cover all my gadgets. Feels nice in hand with rounded edges and a high quality finish. The integrated flashlight is not especially bright but serves the intended purpose. Appears to be well constructed - time will tell. The 18 month warranty is longer than most competitors. I chose this specific model as it represents a nice balance of size/weight and capacity. I will probably snag another for the spouse.UPDATE 01/05/2013: After a few uses my unit began spontaneously disconnecting from various devices after 20-30 sec. Attempted the usual remediations including charging (twice), validating connections, consulting the manufactures web site. As other Amazon reviewers have reported similar symptoms I opted to return and purchase a competing product with similar specifications. Lowering star rating from 5 to 3 reflecting my recent experience while acknowledging it could have been a sample defect.UPDATE 02/05/2013: A Laptopmate Customer Support representative contacted me via email and offered to send a replacement unit. That unit has worked well for ~10 days paired with an iPhone 5. I can recharge the phone 2-3 times which permits all day operation under heavy use. While I still need to carry a Lightning to USB Cable (Anker does not supply a Lightning tip) I do not have to lug along a charger or worry about finding an outlet in an unfamiliar location. Nice! I still prefer operational nuances and the accessories including with a remarkably similar competing unit but the Anker variant now ranks a close second. Bumped star rating from 3 to 4 (-1 star for hassles associated with first unit and modest accessory kit relative to competitors).

    Rating: 1

    2013-01-18: Because I travel a lot, I've always had a battery case for my iPhone, but when I got my iPhone 5, such cases were not yet available. I got this Anker (and an extra lightning cable) to use primarily as an iPhone charger, but it's so versatile that I can use it for just about anything I carry with me: Kindle, camera, bluetooth headphone, iPad, whatever. The battery holds about 2 1/2 full iPhone 5 charges, with a minimum efficiency rate of 70%. The new iPad takes a lot more juice than an iPhone, so you won't get a full charge out of the Astro. (I can't say how much because I don't use it for my IPad -- at least, I haven't yet.) Other devices will take varying amounts of juice, depending on the size of their battery. But everything than can charge with a USB cable will be able to draw power from this Anker external battery.The battery itself is 3 3/4" long by 1 1/2" wide by 3/4" thick. It has blue lighted dots on the top to show you how much power remains, a useful feature if you want to charge a device but don't want to use up everything you have. It comes with a USB charging cord (but no wall outlet plug -- you supply that yourself if you want to charge it more quickly); adaptors for micro-USB, mini-USB, and traditional -- not lightning -- Apple connections; and a soft mesh pouch for holding everything. If you want to charge an iPhone 5 or, say, a camera with a proprietary connector, you have to supply your own USB cables. The battery has an LED flashlight on one end that provides a focused, close-up beam; in my opinion, this is strictly an emergency light for dimly illuminating a small area -- a nice feature but nothing exciting. Make sure that you charge the battery in the "in" connection, and plug in your to-be-charged devices in the "out" port. If you aren't paying attention, the difference is easy to overlook.This battery feels solid and looks well-made. I'm glad that the lack of battery cases for the iPhone 5 made me turn to Anker.-- Debbie Lee Wesselmann

    Rating: 4

    2012-08-02: This is my second purchase from Anker.Both times the product received exceeded my expectations.The styling of the external battery is really nice.It will come in very handy for those times when no power is around and heavy use of my mobile is expected.

This was bad since if it were held in your pocket or purse it would very easily be turned on draining the battery. This new version automatically activates when a device is plugged in and long pressing the button only activates the flashlight.

    2012-04-19: This battery is a high quality one and has a premium feel to it. (the original long cable i received was defective; HOWEVER, i contacted customer service and they were VERY helpful and sent me a long cable for free, which arrived just 3 days later. They were quick to respond and very courteous.)-you can charge many different devices because it comes with many different heads that you can attach to the cable-has blue light indicators that tell you how much charge is left-very simple to operateCons:-It has none!! for a 5600 mah battery, its very portable!i would definitely recommend this over any other extended battery. for the price your getting the most juice possible!

    2011-10-26: OK, this battery pack is great for keeping extra juice around for my HTC Sensation 4G, but how about my iPods??? Read the description again: it clearly says compatible with the full line of Apple products including iPhone, iPad, and iPods. BUT, it doesn't come with the Apple connector??? WTF? So, of course, I go back and read the description, and yes, AT THE VERY BOTTOM of the description, it does say that the Apple connector is not included. OMG, seriously?? C'mon Anker. I've been so happy with your higher capacity batteries, but you really need to not mislead people with your description of your product. A real bummer.EDIT 10/28/11: OK, I'm softening my stance on this because I like Anker products. As their customer service has noted, you can still just use your own iPod cable attached to the Powerpack to charge. I still think the title of this product is misleading, or that the fact that no Apple plug is not included be put in the title. Also, another suggestion would be that a small pouch or case be included to hold the power pack and all the various adapters you would bring with you.

    Rating: 5

    2013-05-24: I had been using a Zagg Sparc 2.0 (6,000mAh) for quite some time which is bulky and poorly assembled. But now, I wanted something smaller and more portable battery for travel. I first tried a Maxboost Defender Air iPhone case, but the Air ended up causing noticeable signal loss in weak coverage areas and had to be returned.Next i tried this Anker Astro 5600mAh. The first Anker I received had a charging problem....I had it plugged in an entire work-day, and it still only showed 1-bar of charge (out of 4). I charged it all night long (18+ hours total?), and it still only reached 3-bars. After contacting Anker via e-mail, they quickly offered to ship a replacement. The replacement Anker Astro works great so far. Solid construction, predictable charging times, and it is delivering the expected battery life I was looking for. So I'm giving it 5-stars based on this second unit, and the responsive customer service I received from Anker.

    Rating: 4

    2013-07-20: Multiply the 5600 by 70% and you get 3920mAh (not the advertized 5600). This is b/c of internal electronics that consumes 30%. On an empty S4, a charged pack is sufficient for a charge and a half. You cannot charge this pack and the phone at the same time. The multi prongs for charging are of low quality - they are loose, you'll have to "play" the cable to have a good connection. Buy/use a dedicated charging cable (about $2). That being said, it fit the purpose. Small enough to carry on a plane or on the go. Beware, instruction are in China-English.

    Rating: 3

    2013-01-09: Battery for charging my smartphone, ipod, blackberry was excelent idea. s s s s s ss s s s s

    Rating: 5

    2013-05-18: The anker is a great external battery charger. It is able to fully charge my galaxy II. It does take awhile to fully charge the anker itself.(More than four hours for me.) But it is worth it to keep my phone charge and accessible. I have tried other external chargers, but the anker seems to be the best.

    Rating: 4

    2013-12-11: This like having and extra battery for my phone and I don't have to take phone apart to plug it in. The unit is easy to charge, I do it over night then it's ready in the morning for the next few days of use.

    Rating: 5

    2014-01-21: Bought this for my father. He's not tech savvy, but the device is easy to charge and easy to charge other devices.

    Rating: 5

    2013-04-25: Battery works great, charges just as I would expect it to, and seems to hold a charge just fine after weeks of not being used. It's well worth the money if you want a portable charger you can use with MANY devices. The company reaches out to buyers to make sure their purchases are acceptable (I wish all companies did that).

    Rating: 5

    2012-06-05: I have a Nexus S with a 1500mAh battery and it will fully charge it, when the phone is turned off, from 0 to 100, more than twice. It's a lifesaver when traveling. If you're going on a trip, buy this.To the reviewers who are complaining that this battery will not charge a 1400mAh battery exactly four times (1400 * 4 = 5600), energy does not transfer from one point to another with 100% efficiency, at least not at room temperature. When Anker claims the capacity of this battery is 5600mAh they are saying that it will output that much power, not that it will completely charge four 1400mAh batteries.This battery can charge your phone and be charged at the same time but it takes about as long as charging one and then the other. Essentially, if you plug the Anker battery into the charger and your phone into the Anker battery, your phone will charge first and the Anker battery will charge when your phone's battery is full. It would be faster to charge them both separately but if you have one charger and two cables it's a good option.

    Rating: 5

    2013-08-04: I got this external battery mainly to recharge my Samsung Galaxy S3 on the fly while it's on my belt.I use my phone a lot, watching and taking video. The latter really sucks down the battery. But with this external backup, I can have it in my pocket and connect it to my phone while it's on my belt. Perfect setup.Initially the unit I received was defective. It would randomly make the phone think it was being plugged in and unplugged many times a minute (the phone would make the "power connected" sound). It would still charge, but something clearly wasn't right. Thinking it might be the provided cable and adapter, I tried the USB cable I use for the phone to connect to my PC. It did the same thing, so it had to be the unit.I contacted Anker support. They were prompt, polite, and responsive. They suggested trying a different cable, which I had already done and told them so in my email, but it's not a big deal that they missed that. When I told them I already had, they offered a refund or a replacement. I chose replacement. I had the new unit within a couple days, and it worked as expected. I shipped back the old unit with a call tag supplied by Anker, so there was no cost to me at all.So, here are the Pros and ConsPros:- Lots of power! I can charge my S3 at least two full times.- Compact. Fits in my pocket easily.Cons:- Still sometimes acts as if the phone is being plugged in and unplugged when it's just sitting still on my desk and charging the phone. But it's very seldom. If it gets worse, well, they have an 18 month warranty.- There's no way to disable the flashlight. I don't need it, but did purchase it knowing it was there. The problem is that sometimes the flashlight will get turned on while it's in my pocket and I don't know it. This is the main reason I didn't give it 5 stars.My unit is different than the one pictured here while I'm typing this review. Not sure what's up with that.Overall, I'd recommend it.Update 10-29-13: The replacement device started acting up recently. It was doing the same thing as the one I was originally shipped. My Galaxy S3 would sometimes start making noise as if it were being unplugged and plugged back in repeatedly, approximately 30 times in a couple minutes. It wasn't happening as often as the original, but more often than i'm comfortable with. The battery pack doesn't seem to be holding a charge well either, since it's only been 3+ months, I thought that odd. At one point, after being fully charged overnight, and after being used for only 30 mins or so, there was only one bar remaining. Other times after being fully charged, and not being used, it would be missing a bar the next morning. Something wasn't right with it.So I contacted Anker again. They were very polite and are offering me a full refund. I've decided to accept it and will be purchasing a different brand. I really wanted this to work, but I don't feel I can trust the device to last.I've reduced my rating to 3 stars. The device was well-built, but for me, it had problems. Anker's customer service was excellent, which is worth the 3 stars to me. I may try them again in the future.

    2014-03-28: I liked mine so much I gave it to a friend who was coordinaging events and constantly had to deal with a dead phone. This was a life saver for her and made her job so much easier.

    Rating: 5

    2012-09-12: Sending back because the product does not work consistently. I've tried on my Samsung 3, an iPhone 4, iPhone 3GS and iPad 2, and it only charges consistently if you keep pressing the button. Otherwise, most of the time, charging stops...period. On most attempts, it will only start charging the device after you press the button but stop after about 10 seconds. I've drained/fully charged and tried my own cables to no avail. I'm giving this product 3 stars ONLY because I see the vendor has been very responsive to customers and offer an 18 month warranty...however, I'm a stiggler for first time quality products that work out of the box, so I'm choosing to go with another brand.** For those that are countering negative users reviews on this product, look at the pattern of what's being said. I've seen other users with this same issue. I've seen people scrutinize others for negative reviews on this product for various reasons including complaints about no Apple adapter. What's odd is that MINE CAME WITH an Apple adaptor..! I didn't expect one, but what's also odd is the product description says (direct quote) "2. Many Apple devices must detect a custom USB pin design before they will properly charge. The Anker power wire is custom designed to ensure compatibility between Anker Astro and your Apple device. Using your own wire may result in slow or even no charge. Please use the Anker power wire provided". So their own product description eludes to an included adapter!I tend to be suspicious of overly zealous "users" who counter any negative reviews. I would suspect they are affiliates of the product maker and not real Amazon customers...paid to counter any negative reviews on the product. Go by what real people who have purchased the product say.UPDATED: I have to give this seller credit. They did everything they could to make this right. They even called me and sent me a new one for free. The new one arrived, and it works. You can't beat that kind of customer service. Not sure why various are getting shipped out not working the first time, but I guess that's how the electronics industry works.

    Rating: 3

    2013-07-28: I love iPhones, they are probably the greatest invention/innovation of the current century. But they also have a tendency to burn through the battery if you are frequently using them through the day. That's fine when you can charge it each night, but if you're on a trip somewhere, or maybe hiking / camping, or even experiencing a power outage... this thing can be a life saver. I can get multiple full charges (2 - 3) and that is pretty impressive. The flash light is a great companion feature.

    Rating: 5

    2012-01-28: I bought this for an upcoming trip overseas so that I could have extra power for my (rooted) Barnes and Noble Nook Color, which I use for movies and music as well as reading and gaming. These use a proprietary charging cable and are notorious for being hard to charge if you don't have access to your typical US 120V outlet. I've been playing around with it for about a week and have tried to distill my comments down to a few paragraphs.First, you need to charge the heck out of this thing when you get it. Mine appeared to be fully charged when I got it (3 of 4 blue lights were on) but when I plugged the Nook into it, the charge went away almost immediately with no effect on the Nook. Andre Frederick wrote a review that said to charge the Anker for at least 5 - 6 hours before first use and he is absolutely right. I'd go one step further and recommend that you let it bake overnight.After a few experiments with my Nook Color, I found that this scenario worked best for me:* I charged the Anker completely.* Starting with a *completely* discharged Nook Color (it wouldn't even turn on), I connected the Nook to the Anker with the Nook's proprietary cable. You must use the Nook Color's proprietary cable and since the newer Nook Tablet is a variation of the Nook Color, I'm betting you have to use the proprietary cable for the Nook Tablet as well. Then I hit the button on the Anker to start charging.* It took about 4 minutes for the Nook's cable indicator to turn orange, showing that the Nook is charging. Not sure why it takes that long to get to the charging state but I don't really care.* About 8 minutes later, the Nook woke up and booted itself (normal behavior). A couple of minutes after that, I turned WiFi and BluTooth off and did a hard shutdown so the Nook wouldn't be using power at the same time I was trying to supply power.* About 2.5 hours later the Anker went from 4 blue lights to 3. I powered on the Nook and noted that it appeared to be about 40 to 50% charged. I turned the Nook back off.* About 1.5 hours later the Anker went from 3 blue lights to 2. I powered on the Nook, ran an app and found that it was 56% charged. I can go for hours at that level so I decided to move on.* I unplugged the Nook and plugged in my iPod Touch, which still had enough battery to start up, but the battery icon showed that thin red "you're out of power" thing so it was nearly dead. An hour and 15 minutes later it was fully charged and the Anker still had some mojo.* I plugged the Anker into my ancient Moto RAZR which had around 50% battery and let it cook. After about 40 minutes it was topped up completely.* Having run out of devices to play with, I plugged the Anker back into my Nook Color. I had played about 10 hands of Words With Friends on the Nook while the Anker was busy with the iPod and the Moto. After about a half an hour, the final blue light on the Anker started flashing vigorously so I disconnected the Nook. The Nook battery showed at 51%. I think that's pretty decent, especially given the bargain price of this item.The bottom line for me:Charging less-hungry devices seems to be a breeze for the Anker. I suspect iPad users will be as pleased with the results as I was with my iPod Touch (I will try it on an iPad and post an update).Charging a Nook Color (or presumably Nook Tablet) will tax the Anker, but it will keep the Nook usable for far longer than the internal battery. And the Anker will actually charge the thing. There are many "solutions" out there that won't charge a Nook Color/Tablet at all.For me, this is a handy device and a reasonably priced travel accessory.

    Rating: 5

    2013-10-29: the reason that i m gave 3 stars is that the plug for iphone / ipad doesnt work anymore after 8 months of usage and raised to 4 star for the good customer service.it works well with my other iphone charger.the capacity is still the same as 8 months ago so i m pretty happy about the battery it self.i use this product twice a week and it works well everytime i use it.i liked the fact that it comes with multiple plugs but apparently one is not working anymore.Update Nov 6th 2013Anker customer service contacted me after reading my comments.and they sent me a new iphone plug for the charger, hope that it lasts longer than the previous one.tkx for the excellent customer service!

That turns the flashlight on & discharges the unit. Then it has no power and is useless. I have other similar products that have the power buttons on the end and they aren't turned on as easily.

    2012-10-09: I bought this external backup battery to replace another one that I had gotten (a couple of years before) that had stopped charging my phone.I bought the first one because it could be charged via Solar panel OR USB connection.This Anker Astro 5600mAh can only be charged via USB but it does come with FOUR different connector tips which makes it versatile.It also comes with two cable lengths---the shorter one is 8-3/4" from tip to tip (not just the length of the cable) and the otheris about 30", again adding versatility to this product.I didn't realize when I placed my order that it has a flashlight...another bonus feature!Now I've discovered that my older battery DOES work and that the cable was faulty.But, rather than returning this Anker battery, I'll keep both because of the provision of the different tips.It does feel good in the hand and I think it'll be more powerful than my old external battery.

    2013-08-20: With the recent ios updates, my iphone battery has been awful. I dont know why, must be something software related. And since I only have one iphone I need to charge twice a day max, I wouldnt run into capacity problems anyway.PROS:-charges my iphone 2-3 times-has a nifty flashlight-very portable-sleekCONS:-sometimes the light indicators seem off. Like, it will be at 2/4 lights for a while, then drop to 1/4, then immediately die.-no other cons, really...NOTE: you do have to fully use the charge and fully recharge it a few times to get its maximum capacity. I used this as my sole charger for a week to get it drained and refilled quickly. Once you do that, it'll be fine.Overall, wonderful charger. Also, the friendly emails from Anker quickly thanking me for my purchase was a nice touch. Very great communication, Anker. That seems to be a thing lost these days in commercialism. But Anker did a really good job in product and customer service here. I'd give it 6/5 stars if I could :)

The flashlight is prevented from accidental turn on as it requires a press-and-hold function. This is a compact item with a LOT of battery back up power and better than the smaller lipstick types that give 20% power to your devices. It comes with a USB-to-micro cable and a small pouch. I love this item!!

    2014-03-16: An external battery pack is exactly what you need if your phone does not have a removable battery (or you are just too lazy to get another battery/remove the case every time). I notice with my other devices since then (HTC One, Nexus 5), they also get hot sometimes too when I am using it. I am not sure what the cause is. But I would be careful and not use this every day, because it might be hurtful for your battery.I wonder if the next generation version has fixed this problem? If someone can alert me if they have, I would gladly upgrade.

    2012-10-23: I purchased the battery for my Droid Razr, a bigger battery suck there never has been! I charged it up from my computer, and it seemed to take a charge just fine. The LED flashlight was bright and worked well. However, when it was set to charge my phone, it only charged for 10 minutes and stopped, then only for 30 seconds at a time after that.Anker was great at getting back to me and replacing the battery at absolutely no charge. I had the new one within days of the problem. And the new one seems to be working great. It occasionally will shut off after an initial period of charging, but one press of the button and it charges consistently after that. I've never had another problem. One charge has been enough to almost fully charge my phone twice.So, you will eventually get one that works, and their customer service is good. In my opinion, it shouldn't have happened at all, but in this day and age, that seems to be the way. Simply replace a part of product that doesn't work or hasn't been adequately tested.

    2012-06-24: I bought this battery pack for my wife prior to our planned plane trip to Hawaii. She wants to use her Vizio Android tablet extensively on the five to six hour flight. I knew that using it on such an extended trip would suck the battery dry in her tablet before we landed so I looked for a backup. The Anker Astro external battery pack and charger looked like the answer.We have not had a chance to put the battery pack to the test on that trip, but I will comment on first impressions and preliminary experience. The battery pack arrived already charged up and I tried it out on several devices. It completely charged up my iPod quickly and it worked just as we hoped with the Vizio tablet. The Anker Astro was capable of administering a charge over and above providing power to the tablet while it was in operation. And that is what we wanted from the `external battery'.I am not sure how many times a fully charged Anker Astro would re-charge a tablet battery, but that is not how it will be used. We want the Anker Astro to maintain the charge in a Vizio tablet and to extend the time the device can be used.I have not tried to completely charge the battery in my iPad2 with the Anker Astro, but I did connect it long enough to see that it was working. I am sure it is capable of doing the job with that power hungry device as well.The Anker Astro is relatively small, very well made and feels quite substantial. It will easily fit in a purse or pocket. The blue indicator lights work perfectly to show the remaining capacity of the battery pack. It operates with one control button. It has a single USB out-port and an in-port that connects to the provide AC wall charger with the special cable--also included. The flashlight is a nice touch too. The unit appears to be a quality product.There is a whole bunch of adapters in the box that should fit almost every phone or tablet on the planet.Although we have yet to make that trip to Hawaii the Anker Astro will be going along with us and I am confident it will keep my wife's Vizio tablet powered up on the flight. Heck, it might even have some juice left over that I can use with my iPad2.WE MADE THAT TRIP TO HAWAIIThe charger worked perfectly and my wife used it to power her Vizio tablet for at least an hour toward the end of our flight to Honolulu.

    Rating: 5

    2013-07-03: I have been looking at this particular model (Anker Astro 5600 mAh) for about 3 weeks going back and forth between this one and one made by a competitor. In the end I had my wife order this because the reviews are great and the customer service (if ever needed) appears to be outstanding. I'm the kind of person who believes in 'you get what you pay for', and despite the cost of this battery not being too exorbitant (nor cheap!) I am willing to shell out a few more dollars on the customer service aspect alone.The battery arrived with about a 1/2 charge, so I went ahead and plugged it into my iPhone 5 to juice it up. I was below 20% on my phone battery and the Anker 5600 gave me a complete charge. So I needed to charge something else to drain this thing, so I grabbed my iPad 2 which had about 88% charge left in it and plugged it in. Surely the iPad would use up the remaining charge left in this external battery. It didn't! So with 1 blue LED still left on the Anker external I plugged it into my wife's Samsung Galaxy 10" note. The tablet had less than 50% battery life so this would finally drain the external battery we purchased and allow me to give it a charge.The first charging cycle only charged the battery about 2/3 to 3/4 full. 3 of the 4 LED indicator lights on it were on with the third light flashing. The battery would not charge beyond this point, but I wasn't concerned. So I set about discharging the Anker Astro 5600 mAh external battery once again. Charged my iPhone (again), the Samsung Note (to 100%) and was able to get nearly a full charge on my son's iPhone 4. And this is with a battery at 2/3 - 3/4 full! So I'm on my 3rd charging cycle now and it still won't take a full charge, but each time I do charge it I am gaining a little more power from it -in terms of charges-. Like most everything else I've read about this particular battery, it's phenomenal and I can't wait to put it to the real test in two weeks when our family goes on holiday to San Diego for Comic Con. After that test I will update this review of how it fared with my power-abusive ways against all things electronic. So far, Anker I love it.**UPDATEI've had this for well over a month now and it's fantastic. I've discharged and recharged it multiple times now and have finally been able to get it to take a full charge. Which, I'm happy to say, will completely charge my iPhone 5 2 full times (100% battery drain to full charge) and partially again (between 24% to 38%) on a 3rd attempt. It's great because I can charge my phone anytime I need to without having to find an electrical outlet. It's a beautifully designed product with the functionality to match. I'm very happy with this! Up from 4/5 to 5/5 stars for the Anker Astro 5600 mAh external battery.

    2012-02-27: The first day I got this item and charged it to a full charge. I took it to work where THREE different coworkers used it to charge their Palm Spre, iPhone 4S and HTC Android phones. It's small and easily fits into any regular pocket or clutch purse. A big plus about this charger over other options is that it's recharged via a micro USB port. So I just use the included micro usb cable and bought a micro USB-Apple convert plug (neXplug brand) and I'm good to go for charging almost any smartphone and with minimal wires and tangle! Now when I go on vacations I'll only be bringing this charger, the included micro usb cable, my Apple adapter plug, and a USB wall charger! No muss, no fuss!!A GREAT product! I highly recommend it!

    2013-10-16: I got this to extend the battery life for a Samsung Galaxy Nexus phone whose battery life is starting to suffer. I figure it might extend the usefulness until I get a new phone in a few months -- and then work with the new phone, as well as other devices today.It will charge my GNex twice to full capacity, and also works great with a Nexus 7 tablet. The weight is very reasonable, hardly noticeable in my backpack. I also like the idea of the "flashlight" LED ... hardly a major selling point, but a minor nice to have accessory when traveling.The main limitation is that it does not come with the AC wall outlet transformer part; you have to either use one you already have, or plug the (very short) included cable into some other powered USB outlet (on your computer, car, etc.) That's not a big deal since I have many of those, but I wanted to point it out.I'd happily purchase again, and have showed it off to a few folks as "the latest device I bought that I'm delighted with." (I'm not sure they're impressed, but no one has shown me anything else better yet!)

I kept it in my rear pocket, hooked up via a retractable cable to my phone which I kept holstered to my belt, so everything was secured on my person when I was charging my phone. Sometimes, I talked on the phone while it was charging and it never got in my way.I also own a couple of New Trent battery chargers, and I use those to mainly charge up my PC Tablets while traveling. Those are really great chargers too, but I have the 9900 and the 11000 mah models that are larger than this anker, but they all serve a purpose. So, if you're looking for a nice simple charger that will fit easily in your pocket or purse, and you only need it for recharging a cell, then this is worth looking into.UPDATE: JUNE 2013 - I've been traveling in Europe since May, and have used this charger daily to keep my camera, cell phone and kindle charged. I have 2 so when one is charging I can easily use the other. I definetly recommend buying at least one, but having 2 if you're traveling. My original one was purchased in Mar 2012, and still going strong. I would be sightseeing all day recharging my camera's battery and phone battery on just one of these chargers.     2012-11-11: I bought this device primarily for use with my iPhone during extended bike rides. When cycling, I use the bluetooth feature on my iPhone 3GS (mounted in a Minoura Handlebar Phone Grip - purchased at Amazon) in conjunction with my LG Tone HBS-700 Wireless Bluetooth Stereo Headset (also purchased at Amazon) to listen to internet radio. I'm also using my iPhone simultaneously to record my ride real-time using the MapMyRide app. Using bluetooth, 3G and 2 web apps at the same time sucks the juice from my iPhone in no time. So, I purchased a top-tube-mounted XLAB X-Large Rocket Pocket Bag (yep, Amazon, very roomy), stuck the Anker 5600mAh battery pack in it and connected it to my iPhone with the short cable (provided with the battery pack). The Anker will also recharge my headset with the Anker-provided cable. Now, I can ride for hours and my only concern is the cost of my ATT data plan, which is extortionate. By the way, in addition to using a wall plug, I can keep the Anker charged by plugging it into the USB port on my MacBookPro. Two additional notes: (1) when it arrived, the Anker had a charge sufficient to illuminate 3 of the LED lights. After a full charge, all 4 lights will glow when you press the button. (2) A number of reviewers have expressed disappointment that a wall plug adapter is not included and downgraded the product accordingly, unfairly in my opinion. Although a wall plug adapter is not explicitly excluded in the contents, perhaps the vendor could make that point a bit more clearly. That said, it's not necessary to purchase the Anker wall plug adapter. Use the one that came with your iPhone, if you have one. It's universal.

    2013-05-16: Just got the product (Astro 5600mAh). So far, it works perfectly. I have an old Sony Reader which I will try with it, but I don't use it much anymore.It came with 3 bars still available and is charging my Droid as I type. It works well with the included cables (micro-USB) and the generic micro-USB cable as well. I plan to use it while at work with the Astro in my back pocket charging the phone in the front. I will also be able to test it in a few weeks with my sister's Blackberry, a Nokia Windows phone of her husband's, and my Mother's iPad mini. I'll update when I get a chance to test them out.For now, I am very pleased with the product and its workmanship which is very high-quality. I can see from other feedback that Anker makes customer service a very high priority. All I can say is I'm impressed both by the product and by a company that evidently really cares about their customers. A lot of the bigger fish out there could take a lesson from Anker.6/27/13 Update: After more than a month of usage, I have to say this still is working perfectly. I have been regularly charging my Motorola Droid 3, Plantronics Bluetooth, and Galaxy Tab 2 7.0. The only issue I've noted is that when I get down to 2 bars, it will be near the end of its ability to charge. This just implies that the bars are more exponential rather than linear in nature. Regardless it still keeps me in charge most of the week before I need to recharge the Anker itself. I do wish the micro-USB adapter included would seat more securely, but that seems to be more a product of the design of the micro-USB size than anything else. The cable connection used on the Tab 2 and iDevices now makes a lot of sense. That connection won't jimmy loose while moving.1/13/2014 Update: Am using this nearly everyday and after 6+ months, it is still holding a full charge. I can use it for charging my phone all week and only recharge it at that time. This is the best portable charger I have ever used.

    Rating: 5

    2012-09-02: I am very pleased with this product so far. I have used it to fully charge my iphone 4s two consecutive times, without recharging the the astro in between. I have not tried for three charges, but two should be all I ever need from this device. It is super easy to use, and I was pleasantly surprised with the various adapters that came included with the Astro. I mainly just wanted something to throw in my carry on for business trips, but I can see myself using the astro even more with the various adapters. The LED light on the bottom is a nice little perk. It is very compact as advertised, but feels well made and durable. I would highly recommend this product over other bigger clunkier devices.

    2014-03-02: Works week when it works. Every once in a while it won't turn on and I have to press the button several times. The flashlight has always turned on and off. It's an extra but not needed

    Rating: 4

    2014-04-04: I've gotten a number of these for friends and use it myself. It's the right size, fits in the palm of the hand. It's a bit lighter than other batteries I have used at about this capacity. It takes a while to charge, but keeps a charge for months if you don't use it often. It charges my devices really fast. About twice as fast as using a wall charger. So sometimes if I need a fast charge I'll use this instead of a wall charger.

    Rating: 4

    2014-01-26: I carry this thing with me everywhere. I wear carpenter jeans, this battery stays in my front left pocket and I wind the cord up and stick it in my leg pocket so it's out of the way of everything else. This battery has proven useful so many times for me. If my phone is running dead all i got to do is connect it to this battery and it charges it up completely. It has enough juice to power it up 3 or 4 times on a single charge. It even has a built in flashlight, how cool is that? My only complaint about this though is it takes FOREVER for it to charge the battery itself up. But it's a big battery and holds a lot so I suppose it needs to take a while to charge up. But it just takes so long that it's kind of frustrating. I can plug it up when it's completely dead and sleep for 8hrs and it still won't be completely charged. But it's an Excellent battery nonetheless. Would buy again if needed.

    Rating: 5

    2014-05-06: Great charger at a good size...and it has a nifty little light built in..... Anker makes by far the best charging systems for phones and tablets

    Rating: 5

    2013-01-28: I posted this review: The power control button should be recessed. When I carry this backup in a soft camera bag pocket, the power button gets inadvertently activated and the flashlight eventually drains the cell. I'm tired of finding this backup nearly depleted when I need it. I was pleasantly surprised to be contacted by the seller with an offer to replace my Astro with an updated version that has a 5-second time delay on the flashlight mode to help prevent the power drain I described. The replacement came quickly and I was provided a return shipping label to send back the first Astro 5600. I'm impressed with this exceptional support and service and have upgraded my rating. The time delay should address my problem. I also think that the power switch requires a firmer press to engage.

    Rating: 5

    2013-01-12: I am very impressed with this product, not only it last for a long time and it saved me from running out of batteries multiple times on a single charge. Yes, I carry 4 smartphones & 1 or 2 tables with me and this battery is AWESOME. Will update in case of any change. Will post 5-star rating if this stellar performance continues.

    Rating: 4

    2012-06-20: This device saved me several times on a recent trip. I have a Droid Charge with a 3600mAh extended battery (double the standard battery) this external battery gives me second full charge with a "rescue reserve" (I presume it would give me 3 full charges on standard equipment). I was extremely thankful to have this device in my pocket.Pros:On one occasion I had drained my battery with phone calls before boarding a flight, I used this device to charge my phone while watching downloaded movies and it managed to recharge my phone a bit while doing that. When I landed at my connection I missed my flight and was thankful I could leave my phone plugged into this device while making phone calls. I'm sure I looked a bit odd with my phone plugged into my jeans pocket but I was able to make calls so I could make a new flight, charge my phone and still have enough juice for a full evening at my destination.Recently, when flying over night. I had used my phone all day and drained it. I plugged my phone into this device and I had a full charge when landing in the morning. This was critical as I needed my phones GPS for navigation and I could not find the port for my car charger in the rental car.After a full day of work use, my battery was drained. While at a business dinner I turned my phone off, plugged it in and placed both devices in my pocket. After dinner I had a 60% charge which was enough to make the phone useful for an evening out.Cons:It seems that you can be plugged into the device and it will be off. You have to tap the button on the front to turn it on. Two taps turns on the light. If you accidentally tap the button while it is in your pocket it can either turn on the light or turn off the charging feature. I presume this was to make the flight attendants happy so you can turn the device off. It's a battery. An off button on a battery doesn't help anyone.On one occasion I had left the device plus my phone alone for an hour hoping for a charge. Nothing happened because the device was off. That's very very annoying.I am reasonably happy with this purchase. For the price and the amp hours this is a *very* good deal. Small annoyances aside, it is a good buy and just the right size for travelling.

    Rating: 4

    2012-05-14: In ordering this, I wasn't sure how many mAH that I would need so I error-ed on the side of caution and got one that was way higher than I thought that I needed. At this point, I am happy with the device, it does what it says which you can't ask for more! The light is handy when plugging in devices in the dark (which works very well for me as I work at night). The only weak point that I see that is also a pro is the interchangeable heads to charge multiple devices. I feel like there should be a different way to secure the head into the cord other than using friction to hold it in place. Other than that, I am really happy with this product and I would recommend it!

I had to put the cable into the jacks and then connect it to my MP3 (standard stuff.) BUT, because you know we love a good but. I went for 2 freaking days with them folded up on my head. Would be beneficial, for that fact alone.To wrap it up, the packaging was just in a oversize plastic envelope, with no padding. (May vary by who you purchase them from IE-seller.) It does take my ears a couple of minutes to endure the pain until they conform to having them on. Has sizing to go taller or shorter for a kid. Stretch is iffy, so big heads beware. Cushion on the top make it comfortable as long as you don't have any funky hair do, as well as the ones around the ears.

    2010-12-05: This case is great. I has served its purpose well, especially since I just dropped the phone on the pavement yesterday and there isn't even a mark on it.Pros: The case fits perfectly, lining up the openings with the kick stand, rear speaker, rear camera, and flash. it has a tough plastic outer shell with a silicon interior for shock absorption which, as I mentioned, I accidentally put to the test with positive results. It also comes with a screen protector. The case is raised a bit above the screen so if you drop it on the screen side, the raised silicon and plastic will keep the screen from making contact with whatever you dropped it on (unless there is a rock or something sticking up).Cons: The only con I found is that there is no belt clip. For me, I didn't care, I would not clip this phone to my belt anyway, I bump into things way too often. If you are looking for a belt clip, then this is not for you.Summary: All in all, this is a high quality case and one of the best I have used on a smartphone.

The rubber still attracts lint and hair but I can live with that I guess. I cut off the headphone and port 'flaps' to avoid them coming undone as I found them to be annoying and not needed.     Rating: 5

    2011-12-22: We had just gotten a new HTC EVO 4G, and it was obvious immediately that we were going to need a case for it, especially with my clumsiness--I'm always dropping or knocking a phone off of a table. Reading reviews, the OtterBox Commuter series seemed to be the best balance of quality versus price, and I priced them at our local brick & mortar stores. Local prices were nearly double that of Amazon's, making the wait for the case to be delivered worthwhile too. Amazon's delivery, even during the busy Christmas season, was amazing with the "free super shipping". I had the case delivered in 4 days! (Of course, it does help when UPS/FedEx is on the ball too.)It arrived today, and my husband was sure that it wasn't going to fit right. It was a breeze to get the screen cover in place and the case onto the phone. Unlike the phone itself, it also offers protective flaps in the silicone portion for the various holes for inserting things. The cut outs fit perfectly too. I love the outer cover--it will keep the silicone portion from attracting every bit of lint & crud possible, as well as presenting a comfortable grasp for picking up and holding the phone. It's also attractively business-like and not too bulky.The included screen cover definitely makes this a wise purchase--local prices for this alone were over half of Amazon's price for the case & screen cover.I may not be sure about how much I like the HTC EVO 4g yet, but the OtterBox Commuter case is an immediate hit! I definitely recommend this case--you won't be sorry if you get it.

    Rating: 5

    2012-06-25: I really like the otter box brand and this case is good for the first month about. I take mine off frequently because i have extra batteries that i change out when my phone dies. The thin rubber part is now starting to get stretched and soon it wont fit into the plastic part of it anymore.

    2013-04-24: Great case. Protected the phone, looked good and didn't change the size of the phone dramatically so it was still reasonable

    Rating: 5

    2011-03-06: I recently bought this case after seeing some YouTube reviews on it. My sister-in-law has the Defender series on her iPhone 4 and iPad. I'd never heard of Otterbox cases before. It's a two part case: first you put on the flexible silicone glove and then the hard polycarbonate shell. It's very easy to put the two together and once you get them on - you know your phone is protected. It does not add bulk or weight to the phone. In fact it feels very nice in your hand - very sturdy and something you can easily grip. This case is advertised to protect your phone from bumps basically - unlike the Defender series which apparently you can drive over and still not break it. However the Defender case is bulky and I didn't want that. The Commuter series is perfect for me and I'm sure if I dropped it my phone would survive - even if it landed on the screen side. The case has a raised edge around the front of the phone, so if you were to lay it down on it's face, it would not be touching anything. As for attracting dust - mine has yet to. This case also comes with a basic screen protector. Nothing fancy, just a basica protector which is nice if you don't have one. If you are wanting more protection I suggest the BoxWave HTC Incredible ClearTouch Anti-Glare Screen Protector (Single Pack) ,SGP STEINHEIL HTC Evo 4G Sprint Screen Protector (Anti Fingerprint)orZAGG invisibleSHIELD for HTC Evo 4G (Screen)for maximum protection. I highly recommend this case!! Protect your EVO with the best!!

    Rating: 5

    2011-09-16: I previously had a Seidio Innocase II and it developed a crack so I ordered this case since Seidio wouldn't warranty their crap for more than a month or so. Anyway, back to the Otterbox Commuter for the HTC EVO. If the hard plastic part of this case had a rubberized finish it would be a very good case but, it doesn't and this hard plastic is slick and hard to keep a solid grip on. The silicone inner case is exposed on the top and bottom and it has plenty of grip and makes it hard to get out of your pocket. So the darn case is hard to hold and hard to get in and out of your pocket at the same time. I much prefer the rubberized finish of the Seidio but, their warranty sucks and I have heard Otterbox is great about any warranty problems. Also, the silicone flap that covers the charging jack and HDMI jack is constantly coming undone when you slide it in and out of your shirt pocket or any other pocket so you are constantly having to readjust that flap so that it will again cover the jacks. I really like how the inner silicone part of this case has the raised volume and power buttons but, at this point I am shopping for another case. Note: The holster that came with my Seidio Innocase II will also work with this case. I much prefer the holster of the Seidio over the Otterbox Defender holsters. The Seidio is actually spring loaded and the Otterbox relies on flexing plastic to keep your phone secure.

    Rating: 3

    2010-12-26: OK, the whole reason for me buying a case is to protect the lens on the rear camera that HTC decided to make stick out instead of recessing into the case like every other camera on a mobile phone has ever done. So camera protection was my main focus. And this case does the job , hands down.However, the silicone component involved is extremely thin and cheap. After reading all of the reviews I just assumed everyone was being whinny as per usual.But I have to say it is the only disappointing piece of this product. I figured that since OtterBox was pretty highly spoken of, especially when protection was a concern, that all of its components would be heavy duty. Not this paper thin silicone sleeve that just feels flimsy and cheap. Now the outer shell is fantastic, and I LOVE the way it recesses the camera to give it the best protection. Over-all, I am pleased with this case. But it doesn't live up to the hype I have heard about OtterBox. If it wasn't for the way the camera is protected by the plastic shell I would have passed this product right on by.

    2012-08-30: After reading other great reviews, I decided to select the OtterBox Commuter-Series case for my HTC Evo about a month ago. I was a bit concerned that it would be too bulky, but those concerns were unfounded. Its sleek profile fits my phone perfectly and it slides in and out of my pocket easily; my previous phone case was silicone and I finally threw it away because it would get hung up inside my pocket and I would miss calls. The inner case is silicone and gives extra protection in the event you drop the phone--I have not experienced any of the problems of it attracting lint and dirt that I read from a few other reviewers. I have dropped my phone a couple of times since I have had this case and it has protected it well. I LOVE the screen protector that came with the case; it is not like other worthless screen protectors I have tried. The only complaint I have is the silicone piece that protects the charger inlet does not function well and became a hassle. Like other reviewers, I simply cut it off. It does not affect the way the case protects the phone. I highly recommend this case, and I will definitely check out other OtterBox cases for any future phones I purchase.

    Rating: 5

    2010-11-28: I've had the EVO since it's release and this is the 3rd case I've owned. Compared to the last two cases (Body Glove hard case and Seidio Innocase) this is by far the best one yet. I've owned OtterBox brand cases in the past and loved the protection offered. The Commuter series is a great way to have protection similar to the Defender series (rubber & hard layers), without all the bulk. Installing the case and included screen protector is fairly simple. As with any non-liquid screen protectors, make sure the screen is COMPLETELY free of dust and debris. Otherwise, you'll have indefinite air-bubbles. Once the protector is on, then comes the silicone based inner shell. It forms to the phone pretty well, but I kinda wish it was a BIT more snug in areas where material is thinner. Once that's on, the outer shell is added. I found it a bit tricky to put on mainly due to the thin rubber on the left and right sides of the inner shell and the USB/HDMI protective flap. Once the case is on, it feels quite solid.The reason I didn't give this 5 stars is due to a few things.-If I have to pull the battery out or change the SD card, the whole case has to come off. One thing I liked about the Seidio case was the case came off quickly.-The protective flap for the USB and HDMI ports pops out all the time. Usually when the phone is pulled out of a pocket. If there was a "plug" similar to the HPJ protective flap, then this would probably reduce the likeliness of this occurring.-The inner silicone shell could be a bit more snug. When I'm taking off or putting on the outer hard shell, I feel like I'm going to tear the thinner areas of the inner shell.-The Kickstand. With the Body Glove and Seidio case, it was pretty easy to open the kickstand. Much more difficult with this case. Also the phone is much more unstable with the kickstand open on it's side. I feel like any slight movement will cause the phone to fall over when I'm watching a movie or reading a book.Overall though, I'm quite happy with this case :)

    Rating: 4

    2011-03-04: The quality of the case is up to typical Otterbox standards, that is to say it is well made and fits the phone very well. I love Otterbox cases, but this one has some serious design flaws. If you carry in your pocket, the rubber plugs keep pulling out every time you pull the phone out. But if you carry in a snap-in holster (like the Seidio one), the floppy rubber top edge catches on the clip and you have to use two hands to put it in the holster. So neither carry option is good with this case.For pocket carriers, I would recommend looking to a different case, OR cutting the plugs off this case.For holster carriers, I recommend the Seidio case/holster combo. I ended up purchasing it and it works very well. The Seidio case is also smooth enough that it can slip into a pocket for occasional pocket carry.

    Rating: 2

    2011-07-17: I bought this case after reading multiple reviews and speaking with the employees at Sprint (both of the guys working at my store had this case and swore by it). The case has performed well so far, but the plastic screen protector isn't the highest quality.The screen protector scuffed in several places within a few days of use and as a result sometimes creates errors when using the touch screen. I used my phone for 3 months without a screen protector and never had any issues with scratches or scuffing, and this protector scuffed within a week. That said, the screen protector did it's job and the screen has not been damaged - just the screen protector. I will find another brand to use for the replacement screen protector.As for the case itself, it works well. I've dropped my phone once or twice and it is no worse for wear. It fits snugly and isn't too bulky, so you can still carry your phone in your pocket without it being too cumbersome. My only complaint is the rubber inner case doesn't fit well and is beginning to stretch out, as are the flaps which cover the connection points. I've only had the case for a month, so that seems to be a little quick for it to begin showing a lot of wear (especially since I work from home and don't abuse my phones).Overall this is a nice case and works as advertised, but it's not quite 5 stars in my book.

    2013-07-04: The EasyAcc 10000mAh External Battery is a handy device for a quick charge of your iPhone, iPad or iPod touch (up to 4th generation), with the included 30-pin to USB connector. I also used it to charge myHTC One V Prepaid Android Phone (Virgin Mobile)with the included micro USB cord.Despite being listed as a product this item charges, my iPad mini's cord was not included. The mini was quickly charged by this battery (as was the unlisted iPod touch 5th generation), but my own cord was needed. There is no includedApple Lightning to USB Cableincluded with this external battery charger.In addition to those devices which I own and tested with it, the battery can also charge Android tablets and multiple brands of smartphones; per the link description.What I liked about this product:1. It works!2. It's very quick to charge smaller devices like iPhones and smartphones. Three devices: iPhone 4S, iPad mini, and HTC One V smartphone all charged before starting on the iPad 3, with over half the battery still charged.3. Despite being lower capacity than their other similar products, it worked very well and on multiple devices prior to needing to be recharged.4. It's not much bigger than my iPhone, making it easy to carry with me in my purse, backpack or pocket.5. You can charge (2) products at the same time with the (2) USB 2.0 ports.6. Recharging the battery was quick via my PC's USB port.7. Highly portable.8. Battery seems well made and did not heat up at all during charging or discharging.What I didn't like or would like to see improved upon:1. The directions that come with the product were written by non-native English speaking writers. Some of the directions were confusing because of this, and some points were lost in translation.2. A lightining cable connector should be included with this battery if it is designed to charge i-devices using it like the iPhone 5, iPad mini and iPod touch 5th generation. Undoubtedly this will be the new Apple standard and adding that connector would be a great addition to this product.3. It is recommended in the directions that you NOT use the USB port on your PC to charge it, but instead use a micro USB charger which is not included (per the instructions). "What?" This again goes to the poor directions. There is a micro USB cord (used for smartphones and tablets) that fits into the side of the battery where it says 'IN'. This connects to your PC's USB port and that's the only way to charge it.4. There's NO AC plug-in for this battery to charge it. You must charge it via a USB port on a laptop or PC.5. No USB 3.0 port on this battery.6. I Included carrying pouch did not fit the item. The pouch was too small.Overall, this is a very good external battery charger for iPhones, iPods and smartphones. It's OK for tablets and iPads, but will take longer to charge those devices. It also works well with the iPad mini andApple iPod touch 16GB Black/Silver (5th Generation) NEWEST MODEL, but you must use your own lightning cable as it's not included with this device.I like that I was able to quickly charge the battery and then fully charge my iPhone 4S, iPad mini, HTC One V smartphone and still had 50% of the battery left to charge my iPad 3rd generation.It was super to be able to charge (2) devices at once, and so quickly. This product will be a great item to throw in my bag when I travel, especially for my phones.NOTE: I was contacted by a representative of EasyAcc to review this product. I did not purchase it myself, nor did I receive any payment for this review.7/26/13: UPDATEWe had a power outage today and my iPhone battery was low. I hooked it up to this external battery and it charged fully in 30 minutes. I then topped off the battery in my iPad 3 which had been on 60%, and fully charged an iPod Touch 1st Gen that I keep in my purse for hooking up to the car stereo. The battery STILL had juice!I'm more and more impressed with this product and increased the review to 5 stars. It works well, stays cool, simple to use, and works as intended.I also like that as the battery is depleted, I see the 4 blue (illuminated) bars go down to show battery capacity. The lighted bars are only on briefly when turning on the device and when connected to the item being charged (as it's charging).8/21/13; UPDATEI continue to love this product! I now carry it with me either in my car or in my purse for a quick charge of my iPhone 4S. The battery blinks its blue lights to indicate the iPhone is fully charged and shuts itself off, not continuing to deplete the battery. I'm getting 4-5 full charges off one fully charged battery, and the charges are very quick!Very impressed with this product.
